boardgame.name: Fallout
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This short tie-in adventure is a one-act cinematic scenario for the ALIEN Roleplaying game published by Free League Publishing. It is designed to provide a brief taste of ALIEN RPG Cinematic gameplay. In this scenario, the players take the roles of a free trader and a group of scientists operating out of Park-Weyland Station in the Three World Empire's (3WE) Weyland Isles Sector – the same area of space as New Albion and LV-187 in this novel.

User addendum:
This 36 pages adventure was published as a bonus feature of the novel "Alien: Colony War" by David Barnett, published by Titan Books.

boardgame.name: Cryptid Cafe: Server Pack
boardgame.description:
You can now play as your favorite cryptid in Cryptid Cafe.
You'll get 3 of each cryptid server, in 16 unique designs, for a total of 48 cryptid servers!
All the cryptid servers are 1-color screen printed.

Cryptid Cafe Server pack includes - Snallygaster, Flatwoods Monster, Mothman, Thunderbird, Jersey Devil, Grafton Monster, Chupacabra, Wendigo, Jackalope, Yeti, Ogopogo, Bunyip, Loveland Frogman, Beast of Busco, Loch Ness, and Brown Sasquatch.
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Cryptid Cafe Server Pack

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: This contains only 2 out of 3 sets of meeples (16 meeples each, for a total of 32).

boardgame.name: Planetenjäger
boardgame.description:
"Planetenjäger: Discover the solar system"

Are you ready for one of the most adventurous expeditions
ever undertaken by man?

Then discover our solar system! Travel through the solar
system on an exciting and dangerous hunt for the planets.
Only if you move tactically smart with your rocket over
their orbits, you will reach the goal and get the planet
cards.

But be careful: As a hunter you can become the hunted,
because other players are eagerly lurking as space pirates
for prey - for the fuel of your rocket and your planet
cards! Comets can seal your fate, so keep an eye on them!

With friendly support of ESA and DLR.

boardgame.name: The Glatisant (Issue #27)
boardgame.description:
From website:

Welcome to The Glatisant, Questing Beast’s free monthly newsletter.

Reviews
Industry News and Community Projects
Artificial Intelligence
Art
Theory and Advice
History
Rules and Game Design
Worldbuilding

boardgame.name: Trembling Footsteps
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Shagmoor Heaths are home to shepherds and their flocks, and not much more. Life is simple and peaceful. But recently, the heaths have become a hunting ground for massive burrowing beasts, feasting on the sheep and goats where they can. The locals have little in the way of stopping these creatures as their hides are plated and their hunger insatiable. They must depend on the hearts and steel of brave warriors to slay the underground invaders, to cease the trembling in their footsteps.

Trembling Footsteps is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 10th-level characters. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Fogheart: The Torso of The Giant King (OSE)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fogheart is an island situated in the middle of The Black Lake, surrounded by a mysterious fog that moves like a living breath. This small setting and sandbox adventure allows you to explore different locations around the island, meet its inhabitants, and uncover the mystery that connects it to the ancient history of The Forest.

Once upon a time, long before the heyday of the plains folk and the inevitable fall of their empire, deep within the forest, there was a mythical creature that stood upon all the others. Some of the old and forgotten tales, only remembered by the eldest roots, refer to this creature as an implacable tyrant who ruled with an iron fist. There are songs that birds keep secret that speak about the benevolence of this colossal presence, who supposedly wandered through the forest transforming every inch of soil into blooming life. Truth is The Giant King didn’t seem to welcome the arrival of foreigners, and soon enough, a war happened.

Fogheart: The Torso of The Giant King is the first installment in a series of modular adventures that revolve around the scattered remains of an ancient creature that once ruled over the forest. You can use them separately, or combine them into a bigger campaign setting that develops all over The Forest, a place full of mystery and forgotten magic.

This adventure contains
A mysterious and compelling lake island
Six distinct locations to explore
Six unique myconid folks to interact
Ten new creatures to fear, defy or befriend
Five original relics to expand your toolset
One morally questionable wizard
Lots of fog and fungi (And original art)

boardgame.name: Fogheart: The Torso of The Giant King (Cairn)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fogheart is an island situated in the middle of The Black Lake, surrounded by a mysterious fog that moves like a living breath. This small setting and sandbox adventure allows you to explore different locations around the island, meet its inhabitants, and uncover the mystery that connects it to the ancient history of The Forest.

Once upon a time, long before the heyday of the plains folk and the inevitable fall of their empire, deep within the forest, there was a mythical creature that stood upon all the others. Some of the old and forgotten tales, only remembered by the eldest roots, refer to this creature as an implacable tyrant who ruled with an iron fist. There are songs that birds keep secret that speak about the benevolence of this colossal presence, who supposedly wandered through the forest transforming every inch of soil into blooming life. Truth is The Giant King didn’t seem to welcome the arrival of foreigners, and soon enough, a war happened.

Fogheart: The Torso of The Giant King is the first installment in a series of modular adventures that revolve around the scattered remains of an ancient creature that once ruled over the forest. You can use them separately, or combine them into a bigger campaign setting that develops all over The Forest, a place full of mystery and forgotten magic.

This adventure contains
A mysterious and compelling lake island
Six distinct locations to explore
Six unique myconid folks to interact
Ten new creatures to fear, defy or befriend
Five original relics to expand your toolset
One morally questionable wizard
Lots of fog and fungi (And original art)

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #13)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the ThunderZine, the support 'zine for all of Kyoudai Games brands, including the Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game, the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for Tiny Supers, and Thunderscape in all its many forms!

The ThunderZine is developed for and with the members of the Kyoudai Games Patreon, who get it several months in advance of the public and who have the opportunity to contribute ideas and requests for specific content.

In this thirteenth issue:

For Infinity's Edge, discover the vestiges of true power in Artifacts of the Immortal Empire!
You're going to need it sooner or later! A guide to Spawning & Respawning for Infinity's Edge!
New heritages for Thunderscape TinyD6 in Faerkin Bloodlines, Expanded!
In Thunderscape TinyD6, learn about the Calendar of the Known Lands!
In Tiny Legacies, find the truth behind the mysteries of the Legendary Cities!
In Random Heroes, meet the most mysterious man of magic, Dichotomy, for Tiny Legacies! Is he a hero or a villain? Or both?

boardgame.name: Frontier Explorer (Issue 36 - Spring 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to issue 36 of the Frontier Explorer. While it wasn’t intended, this issue ended up with a Knight Hawks theme with details on a number of different ships and lots of rules related to starships.

Steven Parenteau gives us two different ships with deck plans along with an article about a small PSA inspired by thinking about life onboard those starships. Tom Verreault gives us an article about digger shuttles, some expanded starship repair rules, and a look at the hazards of prolonged exposure to zero gravity. He also provides a review of the Dark Colony adventure, a hacker archetype, a look at scanners, and a creature. Rounding out the starship articles is a freighter design by Ricard Rose.

Jerry Boucher provides us with a second installment in his series on aircars, and Rod McDonough gives us the second part of his fiction piece started in last issue.

Finally, Oscar Rios gives us an article about dralasite reproduction and how they switch genders.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The Alpha to Zed of Frontier Scanners
Expanded Repair & Maintenance Rules for Knight Hawks Starships
The Goliath Bucket Mouth Crab of Lossend
The Invasion of Gran Quivera - Part 2

boardgame.name: Derelict Cruisers Part II: Binary Input
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dark ultra-short sci-fi derelict space-ship adventure-seed.

Two abandoned ships, crushed and entangled together, are floating through deep space.

The ship’s computers have been fighting against each other for a decade...

This is a small booklet (9 paged PDF-file) with a small sci-fi adventure seed. The GameMaster needs to flesh out NPC:s, add proper values (depending on what rule system you use) and perhaps create maps etc.

The adventure is fast/short and linear - but with some fun mystery to figure out, and with the possibility to play it "good" or "bad".

boardgame.name: Cyber Seeds: Collection 01
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oy, budzo! Are you running a game of Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Carbon 2185, The Sprawl, or something similar? Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Cyber Seed.

DRP Cyber Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

An info broker got the wrong bio implant, and now all his data is at risk - and so is he
Ms Jones wants to blackmail her employer, and she needs your help to hack their proprietary network. She's got the credits to make it worth your while.

boardgame.name: The Rat King's Sanctum
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

A forbidden temple hidden in the sewers, unbeknown to the faithful above.

This 8-page dungeon module is designed for use with the early versions of that one famous dungeon game, but can be used with any of the games inspired by it.

Recommended for levels 1-3.

boardgame.name: Arms and Artifacts of Zul: Magic Items Tome I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the mythical World of Zul, swords and sorcery are the keys to battling monsters and ungodly extraplanar creatures, claiming the riches of ages, and forging new empires. In "Arms and Artifacts of Zul: Tome I," you'll find the stuff, and treasures, of legend: the enchanted sword of an ancient conquering general; the demonic scrying bowl of an evil, sorcerous queen; and Elvish wine that packs more than a kick.

"Arms and Artifacts of Zul: Tome I" is the first in a series that introduces magical items unique to the "World of Zul" and "Free City of Vadashar" campaign settings for Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition. Included is a brief history of the Free City of Vadashar, plus item descriptions, and more.

boardgame.name: Cat's in the Cradle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The survivors find a secluded bayou river cottage occupied by a single mother and her unusual daughter.

Cat's in the Cradle is the seventh episode in The Living Dead Campaign. This unorthodox Savage Worlds Plot Point Campaign for Dead End takes your Novice survivor characters through the first year of the zombie apocalypse with a recurring series of monthly episodes that tell the gripping tale of fear and survival in a world claimed by the dead.

boardgame.name: Asherah
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Volcanic violence in Asherah’s early life eventually gave way to the peace of a garden world that’s renowned as a breadbasket of the subsector. Initially colonized by farmers and other agricultural experts, the world’s popularity soon led to population pressures that prompted the establishment of vertifarms, colossal cylindrical arcologies combining the best of city and farm. But Asherah’s prosperity is also attracting attention of a less benign sort; agricorporations have fixed their greedy gaze on the planet and have put in motion plans to mold the peaceful world’s image into one more to their liking.

Port of Call: Asherah introduces Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe, and Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game players to this breadbasket Eden that is unaware of the serpent slithering into its midst. Inside, Referees and Players will find an overview of how the information would appear in the PCs’ library database, physical planetary and system information, a brief history, a look at the Asheran governmental structure, its tech level and society, a quick guide to crafting characters that would hail from such a place, and a detailed map of the planet

Port of Call: Asherah. Farming is the life.

boardgame.name: Fortuna's Favour
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mid-Level Fantasy Adventure for Player Levels 4 to 6
Intended for Use with Most Fantasy Roleplaying Games

Having just arrived in the village of Portum, you are inundated with the talk of war and the call for heroes.
Chaotic forces from the Under-Realm have taken over an ancient shrine, with plans to invade this land,
The common folk are scared, and the Lady who rules here is looking for adventures to save the day!
Will you answer the Lady’s call, cleanse the shrine and send these evil doers back to their dark dens?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am very pleased to announce the release of the fourteenth adventure in my Old School Series, FORTUNA’S FAVOUR. This scenario involves a dungeon crawl into the abandoned shrine of an ancient goddess of luck and chance, known to locals as the Fane of Fortuna. The action takes place in the far eastern section of the mighty empire known as The Imperium, in the tiny province of Tranquillam, which is governed by the legendary halfling adventurer Lady Lorry Trailchaser, whose throne rests in her fort at Portum. Tranquillam is the smallest province in the empire but, like Lorry herself, what it lacks in size it makes up for in quality. It has some of the most fertile farms and richest grassland in the empire, producing wines and horses prized throughout the realms. It is also the home to a renowned spy academy, the Schola Umbra, rumoured to be a front for a spy network and thieves' guild.

Synopsis: Lorry Trailchaser’s province is prosperous; she is known far and wide as a shrewd, but fair ruler; and her subjects are happy. Well at least they were happy until recent shocking events along the province’s norther border. Farmers discovered a battered and bloodied militia unit hung from trees by their ankles. All of them were dead save for one lucky soul. This sole survivor's wounds were bound by a local druid, but he could not heal her mind. There was madness in the young woman’s eyes as she repeatedly stated, “They are coming from below; they are coming for us!”

After being transported to the military hospital in Portum, the woman’s recovery was overseen by the province’s finest healers. Once she healthy enough to tell her story, she spun a harrowing tale of capture, torture and a foothold situation involving a group of Chaotic invaders from the Under-Realm! After researching the clues the soldier provided, the authorities determined the location of the invader’s camp: a cave shrine surrounded by roses and known to locals as the Fane of Fortuna, a mere 7 miles distant from the capital! The common folk are frightened, the Lady wants action, and thus a call goes out for adventurers to aid them in their time of need.

This is where your players come in: will they answer the call for heroes?
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Grove
boardgame.description:
Grove is an easy to learn tactical card game for 2-4 players that inspires exciting combinations with a variety of unique cards.

In the realm of Nemus, within the forests known as the Grove, formidable Leaders come together once a year to battle for rulership. In the Market, the Leaders must assemble the most mighty Party to fight for victory; be it terrifying Beasts, valiant Heroes, extraordinary Items, powerful Weapons or mystical Relics.

Who's Party will prove the strongest? Which Leader will dominate the Grove?

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Tiny Legacies: Heroes & Villains Deck
boardgame.description:
The heroes and villains of the Legacy Universe are ready for battle!

This 25-card deck presents all the characters found in the pages of Tiny Legacies, the sourcebook for the Tiny Supers role-playing game. Full character art on the front to present to your players, with all the stats necessary to run the game on the back for your GMing needs!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Impulse Drive Cards
boardgame.description:
Deck out your Crew

Track your characters Weapons, Equipment, Modifications, & special Moves with these 120 double sided cards for Impulse Drive. With status effects along the edge, you will always know which Gear and Moves you can use at a glance, and change their status with a stylish flick of your wrist. Each card combines two pieces of Gear or Moves, doubling the effectiveness of the deck and ensuring you have enough shotguns, grenades, and tactical packs for an entire spaceship full of misfits.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Toil and Trouble
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true enemy plaguing the southern verges of the Sesve Forest has been revealed. First, they warred against the witches in the tiny hamlet of Volage. Then they sent their werewolf allies to ravage the flocks and herds in the lands around the forest. Now their Covenstead has been located, and the true enemy has at last been identified.

You and your companions must strike against this new coven in the heart of their own stronghold. Only by destroying this ultimate threat can peace and goodness be restored. This adventure is the climax of a trilogy of adventure modules, but can easily be played as a stand-alone module.

boardgame.name: A Starship's Story
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Starships are more than just a convenient way to get from System A to System B. They also serve as home, weapon, shelter, escape, and even bargaining chips. The Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe, and Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game has rules for constructing them in as much or as little detail as the Referee likes.

But what of the backstories of these vessels? Few PCs get hold of one straight out of the shipyard; by the time the adventurers have taken possession, the ship has probably been “around the galaxy” a few times. Each patch, dent, ding, and upgrade tells a story woven into the larger story of the ship’s existence.

A Starship’s Story offers the Referee an opportunity to create a backstory for that new toy the PCs have acquired. By using a familiar generation and lifepath mechanic, the ship’s background can be created in the same amount of time it would take to create a character. The document includes tables for term events and mission types based on ship type, and even quirks vessels can pick up along the way.

A Starship’s Story. Just sit right back and you’ll hear a tale…

boardgame.name: Advanced Tiny Dungeon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

HEARKEN BACK TO THE GAMES OF YESTERYEAR, AS THE PREMIER MINIMALIST ROLEPLAYING GAME GETS COMPLEX!
Advanced Tiny Dungeon is Tiny Dungeon 2e, turned up to 11 (10 wasn't complex enough). Written by Mark Parish, Advanced Tiny Dungeon features more complex rules, more involved options, and more choices to make! If you wanted your streamlined gaming a bit more crunchy, here's how you get it! It's the the big sibling to the game you already know and love! We dug it out of our archives, and polished up the retro-files as a special gift today!

Illustrated with black and white line art, a retro-graphic design vibe, and much more, we're going old-school with our modern gaming ideas! Featuring complex takes on TinyZine articles, adventures, as well as a full-core ruleset, ADVANCED TINY DUNGEON is what you need when your minimalist gaming isn't big enough!

What's in the book? Rules complexities like:

Variable damage
Character classes
Armor
Variable difficulty


Additional elements such as:

Enemies
Adventures
Expanded sub-systems around dungeon-crawling activities
and a microsetting!

boardgame.name: Urban Events
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the urban events in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Urban Oddities
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the urban oddities in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Trollhouse Cookies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The sleepy town of Redminster is just a bit too quiet as of late. Shops sit unopened, carts lay abandoned and not a soul can be seen on the dusty streets of the quaint town. What could have happened to have driven an entire town of people away?

Trollhouse Cookies is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 4th to 8th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 5.

boardgame.name: Go Go, Kobold Rangers!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Empowered with powerful magic and unique abilities, a group of five kobolds are on a mission to stop crime and thwart evil at every turn! The Kobold Rangers are here to save the day! Unfortunately for the town of Larton, the Rangers' idea of doling out justice is leading to the destruction of their property and causing more harm than good. Will your party be able to stop the Kobold Rangers before their next brave heroics?

This week we bring you a very special collab with the help of none other than the legendary Tom Cartos! In addition to being just about the nicest human being on this planet, Tom Cartos creates highly detailed, multi-level battlemaps for TTRPGs. Use the high resolution pre-made maps for an extra level of atmosphere and immersion in your games, or try the unfurnished maps and assets packs to reimagine each setting for your specific needs.

Go Go, Kobold Rangers! is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 13th to 16th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 15.

boardgame.name: Bedeviled
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Safe House contact sent by CROSS to investigate rumors of alien eggs has gone missing. Were the eggs real? Did alien.... parents abduct him? Unfortunately for the CROSS agents, it is far more infernal than that.

This product is a 10-page mission for Secret Agents of CROSS. Use as-is or expand to your liking.

boardgame.name: Unearthed Spoils (Volume VII - Sands of the Desert)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unearthed Spoils Digital Magazine – Volume VII contains the following:

MAGIC ITEM SET – Wrappings that allow one to survive in this inhospitable land, this magic item set allows its owner to rebuff a desert environment.
MAGIC ITEMS FOUND IN THE DESERT – Items buried beneath the sands might be difficult to find, but these ten magic items are worth the effort.
MAGICAL SPELLS – Fifteen spells designed to traverse sandy dunes with ease.
ARCHETYPES – Six new subclasses that were born from the sun’s unending heat.
ENVIRONMENTAL DESERT CHALLENGES – Hot deserts present many unique challenges for survival. Expand desert threats with these sandy confrontations, encounters, and a new frightful monster: the dune dervish!

boardgame.name: Heals on Wheels
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to #iHunt Season Five, tentatively called, "You can't spell Happy without App."

It's about some of the other apps in the #iHunt universe. Worldbuilding, player options, story seeds, all that jazz.

The first one is MedPDQ, which is the medic on demand service I introduced in the very first #iHunt novel, Killing Monsters in the Gig Economy.

Here's what's inside:

Some writing not just on what MedPDQ is, but the way the American healthcare system works and why this makes MedPDQ a compelling subject for your #iHunt games.
EMAs. This is a whole bit on playing MedPDQ doctors, as if they were an #iHunt kink, with stunts and stuff to flesh them out.
Doctors Without Licenses. Then we feature eight sample MedPDQ doctors you can drop into your stories, with story seeds, motivations, and unique features.
Medical Monsters. Four monsters with an explicitly medical bent.
Codes. A number of the color codes MedPDQ uses to classify its gigs, and with three story seeds each to reflect a massive variety of MedPDQ jobs.

boardgame.name: Gnome Racial Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 8-page booklet (3 pages of content) contains a gnome racial class designed for use with Labyrinth Lord. The class combines the illusionist and thief classes in a traditional gnomish manner. Not much new, as such, but fills a lacuna in the game's classes.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Eridani Light Horse Hunter Lance
boardgame.description: Unleash the Eridani Light Horse Hunter Lance on your enemies! Included is the new Sagittaire, as well as a re-posed Banshee, and new variants of the Cyclops and a jumping Thunderbolt—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Bog-Devil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sunset isn’t far off.
Your team of excavators is lost in the swamp. You’re worn out, hungry and tired of the bugs, leeches and whatever the hell has been tracking you all friggin’ afternoon.
That’s when your point guard spots the ruin opening, and the bone pile that is spread before it.
It is the lair of a beast... something that clearly favors the flesh of humans.

Bog-Devils have no use for valuables or relics, and toss them aside like trash among the cadavers and egg hosting bodies of their humanoid victims. These vast troves of grisly remains and priceless artifacts can grow deep, and with a lifespan of over a hundred years, the lair of a bog-devil is sought after by both skullock war bands, and human excavators.

To purposefully seek this known man-eater is sheer madness. The beasts hunt people almost exclusivity, and use their terrible claws, fearsome mandibles, tail slap and volley of javelin-like shooting spines to wipe out whole dig teams.

Still, with luck, and skill, and desperation, a careful band of diggers might try their luck at the beast’s lair, and just hope the damn thing is sleeping, or off on one of its ruthless hunts.

Introducing is our 16th Monday Mutant release for the Mutant Epoch (TME) Tabletop RPG. This addition is the biggest we’ll ever do, and includes an isometric map and mini adventure for about five, 2nd rank player characters called ‘The Bog-Devil’s Lair’. This creature listing has 12 pages of content and includes a 1d8 mutation table and extensive 62 entry random discoveries table for what a team, or stealthy individual, might find in the gruesome bone pile near a bog-devil’s lair.

boardgame.name: Good Hope, Crushing Despair (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Good Hope - Crushing Despair is a stand-alone product that brings expanded rules and content around hope and despair to the 5th edition of a famous roleplaying game. It provides new conditions for despair and three deities exemplifying different facets of hope, despair and emotions. Additionally, there are 16 new spells, a plethora of new class options like the college of emotion for the bard or oath of the chain for the paladin, new magic items, 4 new monsters exemplifying hope and despair and a sample NPC that inspired this book to be created. These options will bolster your allies and crush your foes. Bring the force of emotion to bear in your next game.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Hansen's Roughriders Battle Lance
boardgame.description: Unleash the Hansen’s Roughriders Battle Lance on your enemies! Included is the new Penetrator, as well as a re-posed Atlas, and new variants of the Enforcer and jumping Hatchetman—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Northwind Highlanders Command Lance
boardgame.description: Unleash the Northwind Highlanders Command Lance! Included is the new Gunslinger, re-posed and jumping Highlander, and new variants of the Grasshopper and Warhammer—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Kell Hounds Striker Lance
boardgame.description: Unleash the Kell Hounds Striker Lance! Included is the new Nightsky, a re-posed Wolfhound, and new variants of the Griffin and jumping Crusader—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Dominions Divided
boardgame.description: Dominions Divided is a BattleTech sourcebook providing full details of the events within the Federated Suns, Draconis Combine, and Rasalhague Dominion from 3151 to mid-3152. Included are a full historical summary of events in those regions of space, personality and unit profiles of key players—many appearing here for the first time–and game information to bring it all to your BattleTech tabletop.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: enTRAPment: Traps and Hazards for 5th Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Be careful where you step."
As always, Dardan was on point, checking for traps. This hellish maze had already scorched them once when they weren't paying attention, and Gert, the Dwarven Paladin had taken a poisoned dart to the shoulder and was looking a bit green in the face from it.
Looking down Zurt could see that one of the tiles was protruding up slightly higher than one of the others, and he gingerly moved his foot elsewhere. Up ahead Dardan was checking the door and with a satisfied look, pulled out his lockpicks to start working on the door.
Moments later a loud CLICK echoed through the halls and Dardan's face turned white.
"RUN!"

Welcome to enTRAPment where we take a look at the old dungeon classic, the trap, and introduce a bunch of new ones, alongside magical, natural, and spiritual hazards.

We've redesigned the existing trap system so that it conforms better to the same Challenge Rating as the monsters you encounter in 5th Edition, which should make it easier for Game Masters to choose the right trap for the moment.
We've also changed the way that traps are presented, in an effort to make them more accessible during gameplay, so that it's easier for you to get an idea of how the trap functions, what it does, how it does it, and how the players can stop it.

Within you'll find some of the old classics redesigned in this manner, alongside a host of new traps for you to use to vex your players.

In total, you'll find the following:

A new trap system, based on Challenge Rating
Traps presentation changes
48 Traps
8 Hazards, including the newly introduced Haunts

boardgame.name: Legendary Hunters Second Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hunt is On!

Legendary Hunters: Second Edition is the latest volume in our new series of class-focused player supplements for Pathfinder Second Edition, this time focused on the wild-wandering beastmaster hunter class. These savvy wilderness warriors approach encounters with tactics and teamwork in mind for them and their bestial (and humanoid) allies. You’ll find over 100 awesome options for this new class, including an array of Hunter's Bond skills like Flank and Shank, each with their own teamwork and support benefits and special actions, with over 60 class feats for every level. Move your allies into position with Pack Tactics, Bullying Blow, and Back to Back while keeping them safe with Snare Hopping, Spell Adept Companion, and Ever Vigilant, while you trap your enemies with Plentiful Snares and Opportunity Predator and savor their dread with Bay of the Beast and Feed on Fear! You can maximize your connection with the wild and your allies with over a dozen focus spells like companion swap, primal vortex, and king of the jungle, and your allies can walk on the wild side with a full set of Hunter dedication feats like Strategic Action and Incredible Hunter's Bond!

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Gray Death Legion Heavy Battle Lance
boardgame.description: Unleash the Gray Death Legion Heavy Battle Lance! Included is the new Regent, a re-posed and jumping Shadow Hawk, and new variants of the Gargoyle and Catapult —no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Operation Marseille
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Survive the Night Time Terrors of Occupied France!

Having received intelligence from its Maquis allies in Southern France, Section M drops a team of agents into Vichy-controlled Marseille in the summer of 1941 to disrupt a powerful Black Sun ritual linked to the Dreamlands.

While the mission is a success, at least partially, the agents suddenly find their Resistance contact gone, their escape route compromised, and themselves stranded in night time Marseille with Vichy forces on the alert and Black Sun hunters on their tail.

But that is not their only problem, as things take a decided turn for the weird as they are dogged by strange phenomena and bizarre incidents which transport them from Marseille’s mean streets into a number of surreal hallucinogenic encounters.

Are these incidents real or just hallucinations brought on by some afterimage of the ritual?

And can the agents find a way to shake off these supernatural encounters, escape the Black Sun’s pursuit and cut a deal with the Marseille mob to escape from occupied France before dawn breaks?

Find out in this latest thrilling mission for Achtung! Cthulhu 2d20!

Features

Operation Marseille is a 33-page PDF adventure for 4-6 players in both standard and printer-friendly formats. It can be run as one-off adventure or easily incorporated into ongoing campaigns.
Embark on a wild hallucinogenic ride which hurls agents from the streets of night time Marseille to strange chasms, clockwork cities and a meeting with a terrifying Great Old One!
Features an intriguing mix of combat, stealth, negotiation, and sanity challenging encounters!
Packed with incident and adventure, Operation Marseille features maps, playing aids and handouts to enhance the playing experience for both players and GMs.

boardgame.name: Wirewalk()↳
boardgame.description: In the not so distant future, with the advancement of virtual reality and the internet of things, a powerful computer virus capable of infecting any digital system is causing chaos throughout the city. Control Rada, a regular programmer who loves baseball, roller skating and going to the bar. Uninvited, she builds a software called The Wirewalker, capable of hacking any infected digital device at the Wired.

boardgame.name: Summon Skate
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

One day, a cage of light shrouded our city.

It signaled the first appearance of the chaos.

That was when our fight to protect the planet began.

User summary:

Game is distributed as several PDF files:

152-page core book
1-page character sheet (print-and-play)
Two 1-page maps (print-and-play)
1-page play stage (print-and-play)
10-page character cards (print-cut-and-play)

boardgame.name: Pathfinder for Savage Worlds Quick Chase Deck
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Fast! Furious! Fun! set of rules to add action-packed chases to your games of Savage Pathfinder!


User summary:

54-card deck of chase events. These replace the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition chase rules (which are not included in Pathfinder for Savage Worlds).

boardgame.name: #inconversible: Dawn erasing you
boardgame.description:
It's a collaborative reasoning game where two or more players can play.

It is divided into one owner of SNS and other players, but everyone has the same goal.

In the quiet dawn, the main character(owner) who just broke up with his lover is trying to delete an SNS photo album containing memories with him/her.

I deleted it by leaving a hashtag, but I couldn't erase the most precious memory.

Other players follow the adjective hashtag left by the owner of SNS, and flip picture tiles that are the most distant from the feeling the hashtag gives. If the last picture tile after the fifth round was the most precious memory, everyone won. If you overturned the most precious memory during the round, everyone lost immediately.

Leave only one precious memory.

boardgame.name: 黒猫ポーカー (Black Cat Poker)
boardgame.description: This game is cooperative poker. Everyone puts out one card at a time, and everyone makes one role. We will discuss it well and aim to make a better role. However, please note that there are obstacles there. [Purpose of the white cat] Earn the specified points or find the black cat in the specified number of games. [Purpose of the black cat] Do not meet the specified points. However, be careful not to notice the white cat.

boardgame.name: 9ポーカー (9 poker)
boardgame.description:
Explore poker with a simple "Hunt Strength" number from 1 to 9, in this one handed poker game for two. The information disclosure dice determine the number of face-down cards that can be turned over. Use the disclosure dice to predict your opponent's hand and consider whether or not to chip it.

Use "critical cards" with various effects to advance your battle to your advantage.

boardgame.name: Uno Ultimate: Add-on Pack – Scarlet Witch
boardgame.description:
With UNO Ultimate Marvel Add-On Scarlet Witch Pack, players can swap a new character into the core UNO Ultimate Card Game (sold separately, subject to availability). The Scarlet Witch Pack has an entire deck of UNO Ultimate cards, with graphics and special rules, designed specifically for this Super Hero to play as Scarlet Witch!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Gnomadic Gardeners
boardgame.description:
You and your opponent are head gardeners at the community garden, with teams formed of gnomes. You need to complete tasks to raise supplies for the local food bank. Unfortunately for you, your free-spirited sprites frequently switch teams and help your opponent accumulate bliss points instead of you! By maintaining a well-staffed team, complete tasks and accumulate bliss to win the game.

Each round, players place at least 1 gnome card face-down from their hand. Simultaneously reveal gnomes and determine who will resolve their cards first. Use your gnomes to fulfill requirements depicted by the current task cards. Doing so will score bliss and sometimes recruit loyal enchanted animals who will help you in future rounds. Finally, both players pass played gnomes to the opponent for use in the next round, while also keeping their own unplayed gnomes. Win by gaining 77 bliss.

Distinctive mechanics include (1) gaining your opponent's expended cards, (2) a sliding card system to generate fresh tasks that you can slightly foresee, and (3) an automa to support solo play.

Distinctive theming includes (1) garden gnomes, (2) inoffensive but silly illustrations, and (3) an unrepuntant love of puns in the flavor text.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Pory Roku: reDrewno Insert
Seasons: reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description: Wooden insert for for Seasons with both expansions. It will fit cards in premium sleeves and GeekUp Bit Set.

boardgame.name: Atiwa
boardgame.description:
The Atiwa Range is a region of southeastern Ghana in Africa consisting of steep-sided hills with rather flat summits. A large portion of the range comprises an evergreen forest reserve, which is home to many endangered species. However, logging and hunting for bushmeat, as well as mining for gold and bauxite, are putting the reserve under a lot of pressure.

Meanwhile, in the nearby town of Kibi, the mayor is causing a stir by giving shelter to a large number of fruit bats in his own garden. This man has recognized the great value the animals have in deforested regions of our planet: Fruit bats sleep during the day and take off at sunset in search of food, looking for suitable fruit trees up to sixty miles away. They excrete the seeds of the consumed fruit, disseminating them across large areas as they fly home. A single colony of 150,000 fruit bats can reforest an area of up to two thousand acres a year.

Just like that mayor, in Atiwa, you know that fruit bats — once scorned and hunted as mere fruit thieves — are in fact incredibly useful animals, spreading seeds over large areas of the country. By doing so, they help to reforest fallow land and, in the medium term, improve harvests. This realization has led to a symbiotic co-operation between fruit bats and fruit farmers. The animals are kept as "pets" to increase the size of fruit farms more quickly. Tall trees are left as roosts, providing shelter for them rather than hunting them for their scant meat. However, if you have a lot of fruit bats, you need a lot of space...

In the game, you will develop a small community near the Atiwa Range, creating housing for new families and sharing your newly gained knowledge on the negative effects of mining and the importance that the fruit bats have for the environment. You must acquire new land, manage your animals and resources, and make your community prosper. The player who best balances the needs of their community and the environment wins.

boardgame.name: Cyber Seeds: Collection 02
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oy, budzo! Are you running a game of Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Carbon 2185, The Sprawl, or something similar? Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Cyber Seed.

DRP Cyber Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

A working stiff wants to sell the plans of a self-aware powersuit to a rival, but they have other ideas.
A convoy of nomads arrive at a secret outpost to onload an even more secret cargo. Why is everything that gets close to the gate dead?

boardgame.name: Tales from the Gods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tales from the Gods ls is a solo role-playing game in which you take the role of a god over the many centuries of their existence, beginning when they started to be worshipped and ending with their inevitable oblivion. This god will have to make decisions that could be difficult and may sometimes surprise you as you write them. Will your god be one of mercifulness or become an avatar of destruction?

All you need to play is the book or PDF, a d10 and d6 are recommended, but you can replace them with any other way of generating random numbers between 9 and -5.

The game uses the Thousand Year Old Vampire system. Play progresses semi-randomly through the Prompt section of this book. Answer Prompts to learn about your god's wants and needs, to learn what challenges they face, and to chart their rise or decline. Build up a character record of deeds, known as Sagas, and watch them transform or be forgotten in the inexorable passage of time.

Your god

Five different traits represent the god whose development you will record in this game:

Sagas
Skills
Relics
Characters
Symbols
Almost every time you receive a Prompt, one of your traits will be modified. For instance, you may be instructed to check a Skill. To do so, you place a checkmark next to that Skill. Alternately, the Prompt may cause you to lose a trait, which is indicated by striking it out with a line. Ensure that the lost trait stays readable because you may refer back to it later or even restore it. Some Prompts will give even more dramatic instructions for changing your traits. At all times, follow the instructions given in the Prompt.

Sagas

Sagas and Myths are important moments that have shaped your god. They come from your actions and decisions as a god, but also from events your believers associate with you, and they make up your god's core. A Myth relates a particular event; a Saga is an arc of Myths that are tied together by subject or theme.

Myths cover a particular event, but the amount of time represented by that event might vary drastically. A Myth might describe a few seconds of impactful events, or it might cover an epic that lasted hundreds of years.

Almost every Prompt will create a Myth, and Myths eventually combine with one another to become Sagas. As time goes on, Sagas and Myths tend to get distorted or be forgotten. To reflect this there is only a finite amount of space for Sagas on your record sheet. Old Sagas will be lost over the course of the game, making room for new ones. It will be your decision as a player to choose which Sagas to preserve and which to let be forgotten; these hard decisions are the core of the game.

boardgame.name: The Waters of Life
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Waters of Life is a 3–4-hour adventure for a party of 4-5 3rd level characters. The scenario is set in a lightly-populated area and designed to be transplantable into most other settings.

In this adventure, the characters are asked to investigate an illness spreading around town. As the party investigates, they discover that the settlement’s main water supply has been poisoned. Following the river upstream, the party will come across a cult of kobolds worshipping the corpse of an adult black dragon that is lying in the river. It is down to the party to resolve this issue.

boardgame.name: Party Ship Names
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not every ship in the universe has a serious name. Some are named by people that do not take anything seriously. Some are named by megacorporations, signal the type of experience you're likely to find on that ship. In d66 Party Ship Names you will find a ship name perfect for your next game so you can focus on the story.

25 Enjoying My Life
36 High-Quality Air
62 Space Kraken

boardgame.name: Ferret Out
boardgame.description:
Ferret Out is a social deduction party game where players try to uncover the lone weasel mingling among ferrets. The unique feature of the game is that no one knows who they are - Not even the lone weasel.

Everyone has a card with a hidden word. All players have the exact same word except one player (the weasel). To Ferret Out the weasel, every player provides a clue to their word. The goal is to read all the clues, and determine which player gave a clue that does not match the others (the weasel).

Players earn points for correctly identifying the weasel. BUT weasels are clever critters, so all players must be careful when providing clues to their hidden word. Because if the weasel can deduce the ferrets’ hidden word (by connecting the clues) the weasel will earn bonus points.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Jump Engine Parts
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jump engines are complex systems with many parts. Even one of them not working problem can cause your crew of spacefarers to be stranded in deep space or stuck on a remote world. Have a name for each and every one of those parts. d66 Jump Engine Parts names lots of these parts so you don't need to come up with a random part on the fly.

16 Dimensional shifter
35 Hydrogen magnetopump
51 Positron converter/inverter

boardgame.name: Panzer Tiger
boardgame.description:
A simple WWII miniature wargame that simulates battles on the western front.
Suitable for all miniature scales (up to 28mm) and many table sizes (from 2x2ft).
A game lasts from 30 minutes to 1 hour.
Army lists and points values for many units are available on the rulebook.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Drop Hunt
boardgame.description:
User Summary

80 puzzles where you have to move some "drops" into their location.

boardgame.name: Gear Wars
boardgame.description:
-===**** COMING SOON ****===-

STORY
~~~~~
Set in a distant future. Humans must live and survive by playing in an annual game by racing or battling with cars.

OBJECTIVE
~~~~~~~~~
Plays as 1 of 6 unique character roles and 1 of 6 unique vehicles to win based on the type of game modes selected.

GAMEPLAY
~~~~~~~~
There are 3 Phases in the game:
1) Planning Phase: Players will use this time plan for the other 2 Phases (Movement and Attack) Players will play a Gear Card face-down to plan for the Movement Phase. They may also play a Power-up face-down to add to the Movement Phase. Next, Players will play a Weapon Card face-down to plan for the Attack Phase. They may also play a Power-up face-down to add to the Attack Phase.

2) Movement Phase: Players will take turn resolving their movements based on the Gear Cards they have selected in the Planning Phase and play any additional Power-ups added.

3) Attack Phase: Players will take turn resolving their attacks based on the Weapon Cards they have selected in the Planning Phase and play any additional Power-ups added.

After completing all 3 Phases, this is considered a round. The phases are then repeated until a winner is determined.

WINNING THE GAME
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Winning the game is based on the game mode players have selected. For example, If it's a Race Mode, they have to be the first to the Finish Line. If it's a Deathmatch Mode, they have to reach a certain amount of points to win.

GAME MODES
~~~~~~~~~~
1) Competitive Race Mode
2) Classic Race Mode
3) Team Race Mode
4) Capture the Flag Mode
5) Deathmatch Mode
6) Team Deathmatch Mode
7) Elimination Mode
8) Assault Mode

GAME STATS:
~~~~~~~~~~~
Ages 8+
30-45 Minutes
2-6 Players

GAME TYPE:
~~~~~~~~~~
Asymmetrical
Competitive
Cooperative
Family
Party
Sci-Fi

MECHANISMS
~~~~~~~~~~
Action Queue
Bluffing
Deception
Deduction
Grid Movement
Hand Management
Memory
Modular Board
Player Elimination (mode specific)
Programmed Movement
Racing (mode specific)
Simultaneous Action Selection
Take That
Team-Based (mode specific)

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Bernie's Nightmare
boardgame.description:
From the manual

An interactive horror journey testing on player's problem-solving skills.
15-year-old Bernie bought a machine that allowed him to enter other
people's nightmares. Playing with the machine, he found a nightmare
titled "Bernie's Nightmare" and decided to enter it...

boardgame.name: Cyndy - Introducing Anna
boardgame.description:
Introducing Anna is an expansion of Cyndy.
It brings in a new actor, Anna, 5 new plots with a total of over 250 high quality and sexy images.
Anna’s story will be told over 3 plots, depicting a hungry for sex rich housewife that in the end will be put back in her place.
The other 2 plots are about a very perverted and dominating police officer and about teens experiences.
You can expect hot lesbian, male-female and female-male-female scenes with elements of domination

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Hentai Waifu
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Swap-tile puzzle game

boardgame.name: Hentai Waifu II
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Swap-tile puzzle game

boardgame.name: Simpatico!
boardgame.description:
Simpatico! is a social word game in which players try to intuit how their friends transformed one word into another… and another… and another. Each round, the Associator starts with a prompt word and uses instructions on Association Cards to transform it three times. The rest of the players try to guess the two hidden steps between the prompt word and the result. The player who is most Simpatico will come out on top. WILL IT BE YOU?!?!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The EVA Engine
boardgame.description:
Due to a malfunction in your spaceship engine, you need to make an emergency landing on an asteroid. However, upon landing, your navigation system alerts you to lethal levels of radiation from the asteroid's soil. Your spaceship's shields are not strong enough to protect you for long: you must leave the asteroid before the radiation poisoning overwhelms you. The main frame calculates that you just need 51% of your «EVA Engine» power to take off from the asteroid and save yourself.
In order to achieve that, you will have to install 4 engine components in the correct order. If you succeed, you will be able to leave the asteroid and win the game. Unfortunately, the components are damaged. Before reassembling the engine, you will need to fix the pieces and put them back in the right order before it's too late!
And despite the nonnrequired opinions of those who judge a game before it is even released, this game uses "time track" mechanics.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Campfire Stories for a Long Rest
boardgame.description:
"Further Entertain and Inspire Your Players

Campfire Stories for a Long Rest is a collection of single-shot adventures, encounters, and tables to help bring some D&D to the Long Rest

It’s been a long day. Bodies are tired and wounded, minds weary from the efforts of magic, swords are dull, and armor is scratched and dented. Wonderfully, a spot to camp has been found, a fire lit, and a warm meal eaten. Before setting the watch and getting some sleep, a few stories are shared. Telling stories around a campfire is legendary in most cultures, and adventurers; tired or not, are no exception. It is a time to regale past battles (victories and losses), share stories of strange and funny encounters, and tell tales of darkness and evil in the night. These are some of the finest, written down as not to be forgotten, tales of what happens not when you lay your head down and rise with the sun, but what happens when you lay your head down and…"

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Half-Pint Heroes: Bottoms Up!
boardgame.description:
The set contains 5 cards of value 0 which can simply added to the game. The cards added the following rule to the game: whenever a player wins a trick which contains a card with value 0, the whole trick is worth 0 points.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Das Paket enthält 5 Nullerkarten, die ihr einfach ins Spiel einmischen könnt. Die Karten ergänzen dann die Regeln, um eine Sonderregel: Bekommt ein Spieler einen Stich, der eine Nullerkarte enthält, so bringt ihm dieser Stich keine Punkte.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Camel Up: Off Season – Show Off!
boardgame.description: More Camel-tastic stuff! This mini-expansion add more contents to the base game and ... wait for it ... GEM cards and tiles!!! In the Show Off! mini-extension you will find a new camel, new types of goods, new treasure cards, new tiles, and of course the rulebook.

listing.notes: Game is opened but unpunched/unplayed. Buyer to pay actual shipping from my southern Ohio address.

boardgame.name: Ghost Ops: Expanded Complete
boardgame.description:
We have collected all three Expanded Rules for Ghost Ops RPG and combined them in one single softback book. This collections also includes a never before seen:

Background
Gear
Mission

So now you can grab all the expanded together and it will sit nicely will the Ghost Ops books already in your collection.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Ghost Ops: A Modern Day Covert Operations RPG

boardgame.name: Who Did What?!
boardgame.description:
A situation comedy, question-and-answer card game featuring the players. . .and the players write the punch lines!

Each player's name, plus names of other people known in common to the players, are written on Who cards which are used throughout the game. To play a round, a player judge draws a Who card and a Did card and reads aloud the scenario on the Did card incorporating the name on the Who card. The other players write a response to the created Did card scenario on a What card (dry erase), and submit the response to the round judge. The round judge reads aloud the Did card with each What response and picks a favorite. The player who wrote the favorite response wins the round and a point. The judge role rotates among the players with each Did card.

The player with the most points (4-6 points, depending on the number of players) wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Boratimê
boardgame.description:
Boratimê is a Brazilian tongue-in-cheek strategy card game about two soccer crowds competing to push their team to victory by using ridiculous and epic tactics.

Each player takes control of one crowd with unique abilities and must react to key moments of the match. The crowd who reacts best pushes their team forward. At the end of the match, the crowd that inspired the most goals is victorious.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Good Night Goodbye
boardgame.description:
Good Night Goodbye is a 3-5 player bluffing game.
Players play one of three cards to score points.

To win:
The first player to score 10 points is the winner.

How to Play:
Each player gets three types of cards: night, wind, and sea.　The players elect a leader from among their players.

First the leader places a card face down. The player then declares to the other players which of the three types of cards he or she has played. At this time, you may make a false declaration.

Next, all players except the leader declare which cards they will place in turn. Then they each place a card face down. At this time, it does not have to be served as declared.

Finally, the cards placed by everyone are turned face up and the score is calculated according to their combination.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: To Kill a Star (Pathfinder)
boardgame.description:
An Empire Must Fall
The legions of the Ultari Hegemony have been turned back once again, their parade of victories turned to rout, but even now their rulers plot revenge from their long-hidden sanctuary in the deeps of space. Their ruin never will be complete unless their stronghold is overthrown, and the heroes must pursue their fleeing leaders beyond the boundaries of known space and through an endless nebula where dead gods drift and living entropy reigns through a rip in the fabric of reality to find a vast realm left behind by an elder race, where magic, mighty machines, and the power of the mind rule all. Here a corrupted sun is caught in the grip of an impossibly vast sphere spanning hundreds of millions of miles, joined by an intricate network and dominated by the collective psychic power of countless minds. Breaching this shell, the heroes face technological terrors and wonders in equal measure, guarded by the souls of the damned and the scions of the sun, and infiltrating a thought-controlled bureaucracy to find long-lost friends, unlikely allies, and an end to immortality itself. To shatter the power of the Hegemony and bring peace to the galaxy, they must shatter the chains of destiny and unleash a power beyond imagining To Kill a Star!

To Kill a Star is an adventure for 19th to 20th-level characters using the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. This is the double-sized final chapter in the amazing Legendary Planet Adventure Path, a spectacular sword-and-planet saga from Legendary Games blending sci-fi and fantasy, magic and machines with an exciting pulp sensibility and style. To Kill a Star includes not only a massive interstellar adventure but also brand-new monsters, magic, and technology, including rules for explosives and heavy weapons, a full gazetteer of a star-spanning Dyson sphere and its inhabitants, and an ongoing fiction series. Here you will find amazing adventures that span the stars and plunder the planets in a campaign that takes your heroes to 20th level and beyond! Grab this exotic epic today and Make Your Game Legendary!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: House Arano: The Aurigan Coalition
boardgame.description:
High Lady Kamea Arano led a rebellion, dispatched the usurpers who stole her throne, dismantled their dictatorial government, and restored peace to the Aurigan Coalition. Now her true battle begins…

The Arano Restoration has succeeded, and High Lady Kamea rules over the reunited Aurigan Coalition. But all is not well – the Coalition’s hardscrabble planets teeter on the brink of collapse, while its powerful neighbors await another chance to subvert House Arano. More than ever, the Coalition needs warriors willing to do whatever it takes to claim victory.

House Arano: The Aurigan Coalition brings the setting of the hit PC strategy game BattleTech into the long-running tabletop experience. Learn the proud history of the Coalition and its hope for the future, then take up the defense of the Arano dynasty with four all-new scenarios picking up where the game left off. House Arano: The Aurigan Coalition is authored by Harebrained Schemes’ Andrew McIntosh and Kiva Maginn, writer and developer of the BattleTech PC game.

To survive on the fringes of the Inner Sphere, those of noble birth must once again call on champions of mercenary mind.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Nethermaze
boardgame.description:
Those warbands who followed the spiralling labyrinth of Harrowdeep to its very nadir have found themselves in an even more nightmarish place – the Nethermaze. Once the dungeon of Harrowdeep’s architects, this bizarre and ever-morphing domain of pure shadow magic is a maddening labyrinth, full of traps and dangers of all kinds. It's in this oppressive darkness that your warband must fight, never trusting the ground beneath their own feet.

The ultimate competitive miniatures game evolves once again with the Warhammer Underworlds: Nethermaze Core Set. This packed box contains everything you need to start playing games in the shadowy labyrinth below Harrowdeep, including two complete warbands, dice, cards, tokens, boards, and more.

Warhammer Underworlds is a deck-based strategy game of skirmish battles set in Warhammer Age of Sigmar’s Mortal Realms. It’s full of big action, clever combinations and tricks, and fast-paced gameplay. You’ll be able to get started right away with the pre-made decks included in the box – using the new Rivals format – or hone your deck by adding universal cards from other Warhammer Underworlds expansions for near-endless strategic depth.

This set contains:

- The complete rules for Warhammer Underworlds – a tight and concise ruleset, honed over many seasons. This expansion adds fresh new mechanics like Maps and Domains, as well as chilling new lore and art that delves deeper still into the shadowy setting established by Harrowdeep
- The complete Shadeborn warband – Murderous aelven Shadowstalkers that utilise the umbral arts, melting into the shadows and then reappearing to strike down their foes from behind. Quickly assemble your warband with four push-fit models, cast in a deep mauve to stand out even when unpainted, plus fighter cards and a full Rivals deck to claim the deeps for Khaine
- The complete Skittershank’s Clawpack warband – Skaven assassins that exhibit all the cunning and cruelty of the Clans Eshin. With five push-fit models in skulking brown plastic, plus fighter cards and a pre-made Rivals deck, you’ll be ready to clash quick-fast
- 2 double-sided game boards to represent the uncanny corridors of the Nethermaze
- Warhammer Underworlds tokens, including objectives, wound markers, glory points, and many, many more
- 48 universal cards – gambits, objectives, and upgrades that can be used by any warband, perfect for changing up your Shadeborn and Skittershank’s Clawpack decks, or expanding on your favourite warband as you bring them into the new setting
- 36 Grand Alliance cards – gambits, objectives, and upgrades that can be used by any warband belonging to that Grand Alliance
- 11 Dice – 5 Attack dice, 3 Defence dice and 3 Magic dice, enough for the most devastating blows, desperate defences and cataclysmic spells

Whether you're a new player looking to start your journey or a veteran gamer looking to update your game for the new season, this set is a must-have.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Quest for Home: 30,000 BC
boardgame.description:
Quest for Home: 30,000 BC is a single-player, narrative card game about a clan of Neanderthals searching for a new cave to live in. Your eight-person clan will trek through hazardous terrain, encountering events along the way, while foraging for food, crafting, and entertaining each other to keep spirits up. No two journeys are ever the same.

You begin the journey with a clan of eight people - a mix of adults, youth, elders and toddlers who each contribute dice to the clan's dice pool. Each turn, you decide how far to journey. You can camp in place to rest and remove weariness, or move more quickly through a landscape of forest, meadows, rivers and other types of terrain. Be careful of moving too quickly, however, or members of your clan will become weary.

Each time you draw a Terrain card, you also draw an Event card. Depending on the cards, your clan might have to deal with anything from a sudden blizzard to an encounter with stragglers from another clan.

On each day of your journey, you choose whether to craft clothing and shelter to keep out the cold, to entertain the clan to keep morale up, or to forage for food and medicinal plants. You can only perform two of these activities, so choose wisely - whichever activity you don't choose will cause members of your clan to become hungry, sad or cold. At the end of the day, you check to see if any of your clan become sick - or if they die from illness.

When your clan finally reaches the cave, the game is scored based on how many of your clan survived, and whether they are sick, injured, or suffering from a condition.

The game includes 13 clan cards, 18 terrain cards, 24 event cards, tokens and dice.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Monslaught in Halloween
boardgame.description:
This game is the new deck building game. The player can select and take the new cards in the hand from the discarded pile at the end of the turn. No random.

The players collects the monsters from the field.
Their monsters are added to the deck.
The Boss round is happened every three rounds.

Each cards has the points.

After 12th round, the winner is the player with the most points.

-Turn
Each turn has three phase.

1. Summon phase
2. Scout phase
3. Cleanup phase

In the Summon phase, the player plays the card from the hand. The player discards the cards as the costs.

In the Scout phase, the player scouts the Monster cards or the Item cards from the field. Then the player uses the played cards. The scouted cards has the Scout cost. The players must make the Attack points from the played cards.

In the Cleanup phase, the player can keep the played cards. The player discards the cards from the hand or the played cards as the costs.

boardgame.name: KINAPA
boardgame.description:
In the usually calm “empire of the Land of the Rising Sun” a wind of panic has suddenly taken the Emperor by surprise , his subjects, the cats and dogs, have run away! The wise Emperor, with the help of his servant the sheep, will have only one quest: to bring everyone back home, with their favorite treasured objects which they lost.

Beware because some foxes enter the dance to sow trouble...
Will you be the one to save the Empire from this mess?
With just a hint of deduction and a lot of bluff, let’s go for a wild game of KINAPA!

boardgame.name: Strategic Mind: The Pacific
boardgame.description:
Strategic Mind: The Pacific is a turn-based strategy set in the WW2 period depicting the war between the USA and the Empire of Japan waged in the Pacific Ocean with mindblowing historical accuracy and attention to detail. Two Sides. Two Commanders. Two Destinies.

Source: [From Steam].

boardgame.name: Mimic Octopus
boardgame.description:
HAVE THE CRAZIEST CONVERSATION OF YOUR LIFE – and perfect the art of talking past each other with the help of weird quirks and everyday madness.

ABSURDER SMALLTALK - Have extremely funny conversations with multiple topics of conversation per round - at the same time! Scores with attentive listening and creative communication!

HIDDEN IDENTITY - Play with hidden roles and secret missions that you do not know at the beginning of the round. You even have to find out your own role through detective flair.

COOPERATION OR BLUFF - If you drew the same conversation card, you play in a team and have to find each other. As Mimic Octopus, you lie and manipulate to secretly sneak into a team and steal points.

CARD GAME WITHOUT PLASTIC - All foils are biodegradable. Parlor game with 110 cards for 4-8 people, ages 12 and up, playing time approx. 30 minutes. Can be combined with all Mimic Octopus editions.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Soldier Core Class Deck
boardgame.description:
brotherAI Class Decks give you cards for all your Starfinder needs.

The Core decks provide class abilities through the first year of The Starfinder Roleplaying Game for specific classes. The Year Update decks add to the core decks with each year's new material.

The Soldier Core Class Deck gives you cards for all the Fighting Style Techniques and Gear Boots from the first year of the Starfinder Roleplaying Game for easy rules reference.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Operative Core Class Deck
boardgame.description:
brotherAI Class Decks give you cards for all your Starfinder needs.

The Core decks provide class abilities through the first year of The Starfinder Roleplaying Game for specific classes. The Year Update decks add to the core decks with each year's new material.

The Operative Core Class Deck gives you cards for all your Operative Exploits for easy rules reference.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Mechanic Core Class Deck
boardgame.description:
brotherAI Class Decks give you cards for all your Starfinder needs.

The Core decks provide class abilities through the first year of The Starfinder Roleplaying Game for specific classes. The Year Update decks add to the core decks with each year's new material.

The Mechanic Core Class Deck gives you cards for all Mechanic Tricks, Exocortex Abilities, Drone Mods, and Drone Special Abilities for easy rules reference.

brotherAI Class Decks give you cards for all your Starfinder needs.

The Core decks provide class abilities through the first year of The Starfinder Roleplaying Game for specific classes. The Year Update decks add to the core decks with each year's new material.

The Mystic Core Class Deck gives you cards for all your character's Connection Powers for easy rules reference.

The Core decks provide class abilities through the first year of The Starfinder Roleplaying Game for specific classes. The Year Update decks add to the core decks with each year's new material.

The Technomancer Core Class Deck gives you cards for all of the Technomancer's Magic Hacks for easy rules reference.

brotherAI Class Decks give you cards for all your Starfinder needs.

The Core decks provide class abilities through the first year of The Starfinder Roleplaying Game for specific classes. The Year Update decks add to the core decks with each year's new material.

The Solarian Core Class Deck gives you cards for all of your Stellar and Zenith Revelations for easy rules reference.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Envoy Core Class Deck
boardgame.description:
brotherAI Class Decks give you cards for all your Starfinder needs.

The Core decks provide class abilities through the first year of The Starfinder Roleplaying Game for specific classes. The Year Update decks add to the core decks with each year's new material.

The Envoy Core Class Deck gives you cards for all the Envoy Improvisations and Expertise Talents for easy rules reference.
