boardgame.name: Crime Files: Die Northpole Gang
boardgame.description:
Solve a Christmas mystery using real clues and evidence in this realistic mystery game - you have 24 days to catch the culprit! Open a sealed envelope every day, solve the hidden messages and unmask the right suspect. The ingenious Advent calendar is suitable for crime fans between 1 and 4 players.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Brewery of Lost Time
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Nearly thirteen years ago, a powerful magic gripped the Darkside Brewery and sealed its doors. No one went in. No one came out.

A few days ago, those doors reopened, releasing a silver mist that temporarily aged all it touched. Yet nothing else emerged.

What happened to all the workers and visitors within? What could have caused the silvery mists? How could the doors have remained sealed for so long, and why have they reopened?

Do you have the courage to figure out what happened within the Darkside Brewery? Gather your allies and find out!

boardgame.name: Beasts of the World
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is full of strange and powerful creatures that can challenge and befuddle a group of would be heroes without even considered the magical or supernatual creatures. Lions, bears, wolves, serpents, and many other "mundane" creatures can be found in this book for those game masters who want to take their players into the truly wild places of the world.

Encouters, Beasts of the World is a compilation of all of the creatures from the "Beasts of the World" chapters of all three volumes of the Book of Encounters as well as new creatures to encounter, defeat, or befriend.
boardgame.rpg: Raven of the Scythe Fantasy Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Volley Boys!!
boardgame.description:
Based primarily on Haikyu!! with influences from other sports anime VB!! presents the opportunity for players to play through the character arcs of a sports anime.

Mechanically drawing from the No Dice No Masters system by Avery Alder, VB!! is a GM-less token based game that provides the tools and space to explore the character dynamics of adolescence in a team oriented environment.
(from the itch page)

boardgame.name: The Streets of Enna Shallu
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dusty dry streets of this city are dangerous - especially for off-worlders

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 60 x 60 map depicting a city on a futuristic desert planet - inspired by Mos Eisley and Mos Espa from Star Wars & Tatooine

boardgame.name: Kerraf Imperial Base
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vessels arriving at the planet of Kerraf make landfall here, at Landing Pad 9.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 60 x 60 map depicting a futuristic tropical planet with a landing pad and bunker - inspired by Scarif from Star Wars Rogue One.

Includes interior and exterior views, plus roof overlay

boardgame.name: Derelict Cruisers Part III: Hostile Dolphin Takeover
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dark ultra-short sci-fi derelict space-ship adventure-seed.

A dolphin created in a lab onboard a science vessel, takes over the ship's computer, and starts an all out war against any ship approaching.

This is a small booklet (7 paged PDF-file) with a small sci-fi adventure seed. The GameMaster needs to flesh out NPC:s, add proper values (depending on what rule system you use) and perhaps create maps etc.

The adventure is fast/short and linear - but with some fun mystery to figure out, and with the possibility to play it "good" or "bad".

boardgame.name: New Players Starter Pack: The Preservers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Interested in getting started with Mutants and Masterminds? Look no further! This book is a supplement for Mutants and Masterminds 3rd Edition that provides New Players with a team of 2 pre-made Heroes for them to jump right into play. This book is centered around The Preservers, a nature-based superhero team comprised of Naturia, Protector of the Preserve, and Alkahest, the mutant master of the four elements as they defend the Earth from an extradimensional corruption: the Blight!

Includes:

2 detailed Character Sheets with artwork to encourage new Players to find the character that works best for them.
Detailed explanations of the Character's powers and how they might be used in play
A background and relationship dossier for new Players to get into character and roleplay effectively.

boardgame.name: Zoknifogócska Szofival
boardgame.description:
Sophie doesn't want to wear socks. Mom worries she will catch a cold and tries to put socks on her doughter. Though she starts sneezing, Sophie runs.

Will mom catch her or will Sophie stay barefeet?

Playing as Sophie you try to blow over standing cards just like you would blow candles. Lesser the tries the more you can move. Mother can follow by remembering the color of the blown over sock cards.

Based on a story from the Szofi book series by Bálint Harcos.

boardgame.name: Építs velem, Boribon!
boardgame.description:
Boribon would like to create a nice house, a car and maybe a boat for his blue toy bear from the colorful building blocks. Help him: roll the dice, carefully place them on top of each other, collect building blocks as a reward. The player who first collects seven building blocs wins.

Based on the Boribon book series by Veronika Marék.

boardgame.name: Bug Off!
boardgame.description:
Bug Off is a push-your-luck set collecting game. The goal is to add bugs to your collection before the nets arrive and whoosh unsuspecting bugs off the table. In the game there are two types of cards: Bug Cards (showing 1 of 6 different bugs), and Bug Off Cards (Showing a particular net color). Every player begins the game with 3 randomly dealt Bug Cards.
During a players’ turn, the player draws a card and plays a card. To play a card, each player has the option to play a Bug Card face up to the table or use a Bug Card to collect matching face up bugs for all players. If a Bug Off Card is drawn during this turn, it is played as an interrupt. In this case, all bugs that match the color of the net are instantly removed from play and can never be added to any collection.

Players earn points for every bug they collect. The player with the biggest bunch of bugs after all the cards are played is the winner.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: One Piece Card Game
boardgame.description:
Bandai's new collectible card game to celebrate the 25th anniversary of famous Japanese Manga One Piece.
In this game,players play as a leader character and use character card from the manga One Piece to fight with the opponent. Like Duel Masters, the player who breaks all of shield card of the opponent and then attack the opponent will win the game.

boardgame.name: Albträume
boardgame.description:
[Back of the book]

Niemand kann entkommen

In den Schatten der Plexe lauern Angst und Gefahr. Jeder Run könnte der letzte sein – doch oft ist viel schlimmer, was man nicht sehen kann. Es ist das Unvermittelte und Unbekannte, das sich der eigenen Kontrolle entzieht und die Furcht ins Grenzenlose jagt: Der Verrat eines besten Freundes, die Axt des Psychoathen oder der Hinterhalt eines unsichtbaren Monsters. All dies schreibt Geschichten aus Albträumen. Aber dies ist kein Traum, also lauft, kämpft und versucht zu überleben. Im Trid sind am Ende alle tot.

Albträume ist eine Eigenproduktion von Pegasus Press und eine Abenteuer-Anthologie für Shadowrun 6 mit vier Einzelabenteuern für Einsteiger*innen und Fortgeschrittene. Alle Abenteuer sind komplett spielfertig. An verschiedenen Schauplätzen der ADL müssen die Runner erkennen, welchen Horror ihr Job jenseits der üblichen Schusswechsel für sie bereithalten kann. Manchmal reicht dafür ein Blick in den Spiegel.

boardgame.name: Crazy Hedgehog
boardgame.description: In turn, each player must spin the roulette wheel and draw the color and amount of spines to pull from the hedgehog. Hint：The player should choose the spines on the center and take it very carefully so as not make the hedgehog dropped. If the player take the spine out and does not make the hedgehog dropped, the it would pass the turn to next player. If the hedgehog dropped, the player will finish the turn of the game. The other players set up the game again and continue with another turn. Continue in this way until only 1 player is left. He/She will be the final winner of the game.

boardgame.name: Co-opoly: a "conversion kit" for Monopoly
boardgame.description:
A conversion kit that turns the classic game of Monopoly into a co-operative game of tearing down luxury condos and building tiny homes for the people. Co-opoly was nominated for an award for "Best Adaptation" by Indiecade 2019.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Uno Ultimate: Add-on Pack – Doctor Strange
boardgame.description:
With UNO Ultimate Marvel Add-On Dr. Strange Pack, players can swap a new character into the core UNO Ultimate Card Game (sold separately, subject to availability). The Dr. Strange Pack has an entire deck of UNO Ultimate cards, with graphics and special rules, designed specifically for this Super Hero to play as Dr. Strange!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Uno Ultimate: Add-on Pack – Spider-man
boardgame.description:
With UNO Ultimate Marvel Add-On Spider-Man Pack, players can swap a new character into the core UNO Ultimate Card Game (sold separately, subject to availability). The Spider-Man Pack has an entire deck of UNO Ultimate cards, with graphics and special rules, designed specifically for this Super Hero to play as Spider-Man!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Airport Rush
boardgame.description:
The daily life of an airport is full of challenges. Control takeoffs and landings, taxi small, medium and large planes, handle luggage and passengers of all types, of different nationalities. Wow!

In Airport Rush you will draft dice to complete the requirements of planes waiting to takeoff at your airport. But all players will be doing the same and you will need to be smarter to score more points. To help you, action cards with everyday activities at an airport can be used at the right time. But beware of delays and bad weather. Do you have what it takes to run an airport during rush hour?

Airport Rush is a game for 2 to 4 players there *will be* competing to be the best airport manager. In your turn you will draft cargo dices to fulfill the plane's cargo requirements and try to take off as soon as possible. You only can take off one plane at time so you had to plan well wich one is better for your objectives.

You will also play *one of the two types of cards available*: the planes and the action cards. More planes means that you have more opportunities to score and use cargo dice. But the actions cards will help you to accelerate the functions of your airport. Bad weather and some delays can occur when event cards are revealed, reaching all players at same time *and* causing troubles in the airport.

The game ends *when* any player complete and takeoff 7 planes, then *all the players play an additional round*. Players will some up the planes points and their own objective cards. The player with more points wins the game.

Airport Rush is a fun and challenging game which will defy players to plan even better every time they play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Few and Cursed: Encounter cards
boardgame.description:
Two new encounter cards for The few and cursed.
In the desert you need water, in the ruins there is a murderer and in the ravine there are strange signs.
On the other card you will meet a hunter in the desert, in the ruins you can try your luck at gambling and in the canyon danger awaits.

boardgame.name: Bottoms up!: Promo Cards
boardgame.description: This cards make a trick worthless and annoys your opponents a lot.

boardgame.name: Dominion: Prosperidad (Segunda Edición)
Dominion: Prosperity (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
"Ah, money. There's nothing like the sound of coins clinking in your hands. You vastly prefer it to the sound of coins clinking in someone else's hands, or the sound of coins just sitting there in a pile that no-one can quite reach without getting up. Getting up, that's all behind you now. Life has been good to you. Just ten years ago, you were tilling your own fields in a simple straw hat. Today, your kingdom stretches from sea to sea, and your straw hat is the largest the world has ever known. You also have the world's smallest dog, and a life-sized statue of yourself made out of baklava. Sure, money can't buy happiness, but it can buy envy, anger, and also this kind of blank feeling. You still have problems - troublesome neighbours that must be conquered.
But this time, you'll conquer them in style."

—description from the back of the box

Part of the Dominion series.

Dominion: Prosperity (Second Edition) contains nine new types of Kingdom cards, which will be released on their own as an update pack for those who own the first edition of this expansion. A few cards will receive minor errata, but these will not appear in the update pack.

—description from the publisher

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: SOS Save Our Species
boardgame.description:
The aim of the game is to have the most species points at the end of the game. Species that are living in habitat at the end of the game give you species points - the more endangered the species the higher the points (it ranges from 1 - 4 points per species card)

In the biome deck, there are 4 biome types - ocean, polar, grassland, and forest. For each biome type, there are 8 habitat cards and 7 species cards.

There are also 2 types of habitat cards with special abilities.

Corridor cards can connect your biome to another player's biome, meaning you get their points as well as your own.

National park cards can protect your biome from event cards that destroy habitats.

There are also 2 Tardigrade cards which are 1 point species cards that can live in any biome

In the event deck, there are twists and turns that can be positive, or negative, and affect everyone, or one person.

Players take turns playing. On your turn, you have 3 choices, and you can only pick one

Pick up a card from either the biome deck draw pile or biome deck discard pile, and then put a card on the discard pile, so they remain with 7 cards.
Create a biome by playing down at least 2 habitat cards, and at least one species card of the same biome type.
Add to a biome, by placing at least 2 cards (species or habitat) of the same biome type next to one of your biomes.


When someone does option 2 or 3 they must pick up as many cards as they put down from the draw pile or discard pile. Then they must draw an event card and follow the instructions

Event cards can do things like:
Destroy habitat (species with no habitat become extinct and you lose their points)
Give you extra cards
Allow you to steal cards
Give you bonus national parks
And more...

The game ends when there are no cards left in the draw pile and discard pile. Everyone counts up their species points and whoever has the most wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dino Fite
boardgame.description:
A 2-4 player card game where deception is your best friend.

Players take turn choosing one face up or face down Dino on their side of the field to attack a face up or face down Dino on their opponent's side of the field. If either player's Dino is face down, they may bluff the power of their Dino. However, this is a gamble.

If your opponent calls your bluff correctly, your Dino is revealed and destroyed and they are able to Bonk one of your Dinos. Bonking flips face up a face down Dino or destroys a face up Dino.

Once one player is no longer able to refill their field with a Dino, players reveal all surviving Dinos on the field, in their hand, and in their deck. Players sum the total of all their surviving Dinos and compare. The player with the higher total power has driven their opponent to extinction and has won!

boardgame.name: Attack & Defend
boardgame.description:
LUCK & SKILL: The perfect combination of both War and Uno card games. It is easy enough for kids to win, yet strategic enough for adults to stay entertained endlessly!

FAST & FUN: Play in 10 minutes. Players will try to build their deck as they take turns attacking others and defending themselves. Once the draw deck runs out, it becomes a race to be the first out of cards.

EASY TO LEARN: Beginners can learn by playing, reading the quick gameplay guides/directions, or watching a short Youtube instructional video with the creators as your guides.

TRAVEL-FRIENDLY: This small and study box can go anywhere! Take it on trips to the beach, camping, the office and anywhere else!

MAKES A GREAT GIFT: great for birthdays, holidays, events, and even party favors.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bad Landlord
boardgame.description:
Bad Landlord is a card game that combines wild landlording stories with dysfunctional responses.

Jillian in apartment 7 had her mail stolen, including a $100 gift card from Amazon. Turns out it was used by Stillman from across the hall. Do you suggest that they resolve it on a trashy courtroom reality show? Invite them to a group therapy session with the other tenants in the building? Or maybe just set them up on a blind date together? You’re the landlord, and the decision is yours!

Bad Landlord is a player judge game for 3-8 players. Each round a judge chooses the best response played to a given landlording situation. The first player to win 6 rounds wins the game.

Don’t we all wish we could be a bad landlord once in a while?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Neverwinter - Elemental Evil
boardgame.description: Over the past year, the citizens of Neverwinter have faced a menagerie of terrifying foes from Thayan Liches to the Dragon Goddess Tiamat. Now, however, the very forces of nature conspire to bring the city to its knees! Fear not, as a new hero blessed by the gods, the Oathbound Paladin, has emerged to fight the impending threat. These righteous fighters will be able embody both the healing and tanking paradigms that have made them so popular with Dungeons & Dragons players everywhere. As the heroes of Neverwinter endeavor to battle the Cults of Elemental Evil, players will experience a gripping storyline that will serve to compliment the upcoming Dungeons & Dragons tabletop adventure, Princes of the Apocalypse. With Elemental Evil will come a level cap increase from 60 to 70, complete with a new set of quests, feats, and slottable class feature powers.

boardgame.name: Like Cats and Dogs
boardgame.description:
In Like Cats & Dogs, each player runs their own pet shelter. The objective of the game is to get all the pets in your shelter ready to be adopted and paired with the perfect family. First player to empty their shelter wins!

Each Pet card has a list of Needs that you need to meet before they can be adopted. Meet these needs by traveling around the game board and collecting the corresponding cards. Once a Pet’s Needs have been met, search for their perfect Fur-ever Home at Adoption Events by comparing potential families to the Pets’ Home Requirements listed on the Pet card.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Au pire, tu meurs !
boardgame.description:
This is a bluffing game as well as a party game.
The goal is to eliminate every other member of the Death family by reducing their life expectancy to 0 and become the last one standing.
At the beginning, each player draws secretly a Role card with a dedicated life expectancy as well as a starting hand of seven cards. There are two category of cards: attacks and other effects for managing other players' attacks.

Since everyone's life gauge is secret, the only way to eliminate a player is to call them out and say "You DIE!". They secretly show you their role card and the damage they received. If you were right, they are eliminated. If you were wrong, they retaliate by giving you one of the Attack card that stacked against them.

boardgame.name: Squeaks in the Deep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“The dogs and cats of the world are not our friends.
They presume we are always guilty of some crime or other, even if this isn’t the case. You’ll have to remember our most important code: look out for ourselves.”
— Meeka Chase, Mouse and potential Rat King

Rats and mice live in the margins of the empires of dogs and cats, with homes that connect to the Underneath — a vast collection of warrens, tunnels, caves, and other hidden places. It is a dangerous place full of unexplained phenomena and terrifying creatures. But it is also full of wonders of ages past and the thrill of discovery. For the rodents believe Man was part of something called Science, a way to learn power through study, observation, and experimentation. Perhaps through the exploration of the Underneath, they can rediscover Science. It’s time to listen to the squeaks in the deep.

Squeaks in the Deep is a chronicle sourcebook for both Pugmire and Monarchies of Mau. It’s usable with either game, or as part of a joint experience. Some highlights include:

Two new species for players to portray: rats and mice
Six new rodent callings
Psionic rules
Information on the Underneath, as well as a variety of new enemies
“Confluence of Cults,” an adventure featuring the Underneath with both Pugmire and Monarchies starting points

boardgame.name: Bad Baby Lich Lords
boardgame.description:
Bad Baby Lich Lords is a fast paced competitive card game. Your father, The Lich King has grown weary of his kingdom and slain all living things so he may sleep in peace. You and your Bad Baby Lich Lord siblings are terribly bored with nothing but piles of skeletons to keep you company.

Be the first to wake Father and win his attention. You must invoke your dark powers to raise an army of minions, battle your siblings, conquer forsaken realms, and MAKE SOME NOISE!

Flip cards to raise the minions from the dead. Every card is double-sided and acts as a 2-frame animation that lights up with life as they're flipped from the skeleton side to the living minion side. Cards automatically perform their skills when they're flipped, setting off chain reactions and combos Meet the realm requirements to score and make noise.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cangaço: Compadecida promo card
boardgame.description:
Promo card for Cangaço.

The power of the Compadecida card is completely linked to the movie O Alto da Compadecida, and makes the round in which it is played a little more dynamic, allowing the whole table to recover a discarded card and play it performing its effect normally.

boardgame.name: TRAILS: Watchtower Badge Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
Originally available during the Dice Tower 2022 Season Kickstater campaign, Promo Set A ("Air").

A set of 3 additional badges (1 each in rock, acorn, and leaf badge type), for use with TRAILS base game. The "Watchtower" badge has a steep cost of 6 identical resources of that badge's type, with the worthwhile upside of 5 victory points, and 3 of that same resource back to you.

boardgame.name: Haphazards
boardgame.description:
Haphazards is a hilarious card game for 3-8 players. Each round, one player encounters a dangerous hazard. The other players use their cards to attempt a rescue. The player with the best rescue wins.

Can you defeat the Yeti with a banana, a circus tent, and a hampster? Can you cross a ravine with a bale of hay, a skateboard, and a jackalope? With 270 cards in the deck, the possibilities are endless!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Game of Telegraph Messenger Boy
boardgame.description:
The card game adaptation of the 1886 McLoughlin Brothers board game District Messenger Boy.

Each player is dealt cards forming a face down pile. In turn order, players turn over the top card of the pile. The initial objective is to obtain employment as the Messenger Boy. Over the course of the game players try to advance to more senior positions in the Company, until one player becomes its President.

From the McLoughlin Brothers 1914 Catalogue - “The Messenger Boy game has been a favorite for a generation, and there is no evident reason why a card game on the same lines should not be equally popular.”
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: The Game of District Messenger Boy

boardgame.name: Vividz
boardgame.description:
The purpose in Vividz is "Faster than your opponent" for the three set missions to clear!
Run through the Vividz world with fame!
The stage of the story is called "Vividz"
Virtual real world!
On a variety of stages, equip weapons that change from stage to stage and fight!
Achieve the exhilaration of manipulating many cards in one turn.
"Running experience" with a play feel unique to Vividz!
First, let's play with the "β card" that is being distributed for free.
With Vividz official remote battle system (Link Vividz)
Match your opponent.
Feel free to play with players far away!
Feel the feel of the card, both real and online
Enjoy Vividz TCG!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Vividzにおける目的は
設定された3つのミッションを、「対戦相手より早く」
クリアすること！
名声をかけて、Vividzワールドを駆け抜けろ！
物語の舞台は「Vividz」と呼ばれる
バーチャルリアルワールド！
バラエティに富んだステージで、
ステージごとに変化する武器を装備して戦うよ！
1ターンの間にたくさんのカードを操る爽快感を実現。
Vividzならではのプレイフィールで"疾走体感"！
まずは無料配布中の「βカード」で遊んでみよう。
Vividz公式リモート対戦システム（Link Vividz）で
対戦相手をマッチング。
遠く離れたプレイヤーと気軽にプレイできるよ！
リアルでもオンラインでも、カードの手触りを感じながら
Vividz TCGを楽しもう！

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Shelter
boardgame.description: In Shelter, you will take the role of running a cat shelter. Send your volunteers out to the neighborhood to rescue community cats in need. Along the way, you can purchase resources to fulfill each rescued cat's needs. Seek help from fosterers or cat cafes if you are overwhelmed. Rehabilitate your rescues and, ultimately, send them to their forever homes or release them through the trap–neuter–release program.

boardgame.name: 时间互搏：学园偶像计划（Chrono Clash System: LoveLive!）
boardgame.description:
From the mind of renowned American game designer, Ryan Miller, comes Chrono Clash System.
The cost of the card moves the marker towards the opponent's side, and when it goes over 1, then it's your opponent's turn!
Play many low cost cards or play a high cost card from the get-go. Play your favorite cards whenever you want in this dynamic but easy to play game!
Utilizing the universal Chrono Clash system, the universes and characters used will draw in players of card games, board games and each respective universe's fans alike!
The Chinese version Chrono Clash system game comes two famous IPs, Kamen Rider and LoveLive project.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: 时间互搏：假面骑士 (Chrono Clash System: Kamen Rider)
时间互搏：假面骑士 (Chrono Clash System: Kamen Rider)

boardgame.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Valor of the 13th
boardgame.description:
Into the Endless Plains of Russia

Valor of the 13th Expansion is an expansion for Heroes of the Motherland from the Lock ‘n Load Tactical system.  It features fluid, impulse-based turns, squad-level actions, and individual heroics.  The scenarios inside represent the efforts of the Soviet 13th Army to defend the area around Ponyari during the vital crucial days of July 6th through July 12th of 1943, during the German Operation Citadel-the fight to eliminate the Kursk salient. The scenarios focus on the battles around Hill 253.5 and the plains to the east of the hill. Massive infantry and armor engagements rage and flow around these battlefields, as both sides scramble to gain an advantage.  Also included are a new set of Vehicle rules that expand on the existing Vehicle rules presented in the Lock ‘n Load Tactical System Core Rules and were designed for this expansion pack. They now allow you to damage and destroy the mobility and combat capabilities of vehicles.  Included are ten brand-new scenarios, two giant maps (one 34" x 22", and one 22" x 17"), and a counter sheet with over 100 counters. 

The Defenses of Kursk beckons you back to  Heroes of the Motherland!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Motherland

boardgame.name: Mercenary Boxed Set
boardgame.description:
Money will not always get you good soldiers, but good soldiers can always get you money… or land, or power, or whatever you are willing to pay them to fight for.

Raise Your Force

Mercenary presents detailed rules for raising and equipping a mercenary force, training your troops and finding the best – or maybe just the cheapest – hardware on the market. Units are rated according to their capabilities in critical areas such as direct combat, aerospace defence or bombardment. Unit Traits provide additional capabilities that can tip the balance of a close-fought battle.

Enter the Marketplace

Some plans do not survive contact with the client, let alone the enemy. Mercenary gives you the tools you need to make sense of a client’s conflicting requirements and figure out what is necessary to complete the contract. Sometimes that is the same as winning the fight… but not always.

Begin Operations

The mission and ticket resolution rules allow large and small-scale operations to be quickly resolved. Referees can abstract routine events and shift focus to where the action is hottest. The scalable battle system accounts for force size, tech level, tactics, level of aggression and a host of other factors.

Lay Down Some Fire

The expanded combat rules deal with life-or-death situations where suppressing an enemy support weapon, getting a shot on target or achieving an instant knockdown can make all the difference.

Inside you will find:

Book 1: Mercenaries in the Far Future
Book 2:Running a Mercenary Force
Book 3: In the Field
Mercenary Adventure 0: Trial by Fire
Mercenary Unit Roster Card

boardgame.name: Les Aventuriers du Rail: San Francisco
Jízdenky, Prosím! San Francisco
Ticket to Ride: San Francisco
Wsiąść do Pociągu: San Francisco
Zug um Zug: San Francisco
¡Aventureros al Tren!: San Francisco
티켓 투 라이드: 샌프란시스코
boardgame.description:
Ticket to Ride: San Francisco features the familiar gameplay from the Ticket to Ride game series — collect cards, claim routes, draw tickets — but on a map of 1960s San Francisco that allows you to complete a game in no more than 15 minutes.

Each player starts with a supply of 20 cable cars, two transportation cards in hand, and one or two destination tickets that show locations in San Francisco. On a turn, you either draw two transportation cards from the deck or the display of five face-up cards (or you take one face-up ferry, which counts as all six colors in the game); or you claim a route on the board by discarding cards that match the color of the route being claimed (with any set of cards allowing you to claim a gray route, although some require ferries); or you draw two destination tickets and keep at least one of them.

When you build a line that connects to a souvenir location, such as Lombard Street, the Embarcadero, or the Golden Gate Bridge, you take a souvenir token from that location.

Players take turns until someone has no more than two cable cars in their supply, then each player takes one final turn, including the player who triggered the end of the game. Players then sum their points, scoring points for (1) the routes that they've claimed during the game, (2) the destination tickets that they've completed (by connecting the two locations on a ticket by a continuous line of their cable cars), and (3) the souvenirs that they've collected, with a full set of seven souvenirs being worth 12 points. You lose points for any uncompleted destination tickets, then whoever has the high score wins!

boardgame.name: Castle made of Sand(砂上のROW閣)
boardgame.description:
Pharaoh is in trouble...
His beautiful kingdom was attacked by a massive flood!
The city that had thrived for hundreds of years was washed away except for the Great Pyramid,
the symbol of his kingdom...

Pharaoh shouted to his people from
the top of the Great Pyramid,
"Now, we shall split the Great Pyramid
to rebuild the city!"


『砂上のROW閣』は本物の砂をリソースに使用した屋内で棒倒しをする日本初のボードゲームです！！始めに、全ての砂で獲得すると得点となる宝石トークンを埋めた大ピラミッドを作り、建物ピックを刺し頂上にファラオミープルを置いて準備完了！
各プレイヤーは順番に大ピラミッドから砂を切り出して、個人ボードに4種類の建物を建てていきます。
途中で建物ピックを倒してしまうと、前の手番のプレイヤーが獲得！対応した建物に刺す事で得点アップ！！
頂上のファラオミープルを落とさないように、多くの建物を建てて勝利を目指しましょう！！

切り出した砂を、可能な限り使い切りながらコントロールしつつ建物を建てていく感覚は他のボードゲームでは味わえない新体験！
砂のマネージマントが鍵となるゲームです！


【Description】
『Castle made of Sand』is a first board game with using real sand.1.
First, players create a big pyramid with dedicated mold and sand.
On the way you create pyramid, you can fill in gem token(*) to the pyramid.
(*The token will be your point when game finish.)

After create pyramid, you remove the pyramid from the mold.
Then, you attach construction pick the pyramid's middle of the slope, and pharaoh meeple on the top.

2.
Each player split sand from the pyramid with dedicated spatula(**) in order.
So you can create 4 type of construction with dedicated mold, and you put on your board the construction.
(**If you get gem token in the sand, the token will be your point.
And if you fell down construction pick from pyramid, previous turn player get the pick.)

If you can create the construction with perfectly, so you get 1 point(***).
But you can't create with not perfectly(not enough sand compared to the mold), you lose 1 point.
(*** you have construction pick the same shape with the sand construction, you can attach the pick on the sand.
So you get more 2 point.)

3.
In the following situations, game will finish.
- any player fell down pharaoh meeple on the pyramid's top, the player's point will change "0".
- any player reach dedicated point
(2 players : 30 point, 3 players : 25 point, 4 players : 20 point)

Then, the player who have the most point, he/she is winner.

boardgame.name: Area 52
boardgame.description:
As the commander of the Frontline Alien Resistance Team, you must manage a squad of elite soldiers to fight off a wave of invading aliens. After the first wave, the aliens will attack again with deadlier force - you win if you are able to repel both waves without running out of resources. Having a good variety and spread of defenders is critical to efficiently counter the invaders.

The game is heavily reliant on luck. Despite this, there’s still an undercurrent of subtle strategy, related to concepts of probability and mathematical parity.

Area 52 is a solo tower-defense game played with a deck of regular playing cards, inspired by games such as Button Men and Onslaught. The rules were created by Wil Su and made available free online as part of his "Isaludo" series.

Naughty Girl II

boardgame.name: Eyrie of the Dread Eye 5E
boardgame.description:
The Eye Is Opening.

Thousands of years ago, living gods named Khepri wielded powers beyond understanding. Their bizarre magics rived a rent in reality itself. This portal—the Oculus—led to the deepest realms of Chthonic Darkness, but it was not yet fully open. Malign forces, opposed to all life, infested the Oculus, and waited. The Khepri kept vigil over the Oculus till time moved her hand. When the Khepri vanished in the Day Without Night, their Elven epigones took up the watch. In time, the Elves were conquered by the diabolic Thrassian race, and they in turn were subjugated by the Zaharans. Through the millennia, the caretakers of the Oculus studied, waited, and watched.

Now the Awakening is near, the Spheres are coming into alignment, and the Oculus is beginning to open. The dark power is reaching out and for the first time in an age the Eyrie of the Dread Eye is accessible again. As the Eye opens, reality itself comes under further and further strain. And as rumors of a new valley containing an underground forgotten city filled with untold riches spread out from the Dark Wall, the Oculus continues to open ever wider.

Eyrie of the Dread Eye is a ready-to-play adventure scenario presented for use with the Fifth Edition of the world's most popular d20-based fantasy role-playing game. Discover the vast ruined eyrie of the Oculus and take a stand against the coming Awakening.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Ritual: Crown of Horns
boardgame.description:
Ritual: Crown of Horns is a slaughterhouse: a violent, fast-paced action game set in an alternate Wild West, an absurd, acid-fueled vision of hellish frontier. Inspired by a variety of unique takes on the Western genre, this arcade-inspired title unravels a tale about an unlikely duo: a bounty hunter who comes back from beyond a grave, yearning to exact revenge on his homeland, and a witch who aids him with a series of powerful rituals to further her own secret goals.

Source: The Developer Website.

It has 4 preset matches, and the full game has 2 game modes: Story Mode, where you will play against preset matches and must beat the lower tiers to be able to advance, and the Free Mode, where you can play against 1 or 4 ladies of your choosing.

boardgame.name: Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible
boardgame.description:
Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible is an educational game developed for the UN delegation in Villa María, Argentina. It is a very simple cooperative game in real time and designed for people of any age. The game also has a debate stage where it seeks to raise awareness about the Sustainable Development Goals and think about what we can do from our place to make the world a better place. The game is not for profit.

Cooperative game, where the participants will collect idea sheets and assign them to the different ODS cards to meet their objectives and obtain the best possible score... They only have 5 minutes!

boardgame.name: Devil Dots
boardgame.description: The game consists of 36 dice (six dice in each of six colors). Each player draws three random dice from a bag to start the game. Players take turns choosing to roll 1, 2, or all 3 of their dice and then adding those to a growing grid of dice so that all the colors and numbers of dice in each row and column are either all the same or all different. Players score one point for each die in every row and column to which dice were added on their turn. Players replenish back to three dice at the end of their turns. Play ends when the bag is empty.

boardgame.name: Ultimate NPCs: Warfare Generic NPC Cards
boardgame.description:
This deck contains 45 cards featuring the generic NPCs from Ultimate NPCs: Warfare. This is a perfect accessory to use along side Ultimate NPCs: Warfare as it gives you a quick reference stat block and an excellent full color graphic of the character to show you players!

boardgame.name: Sword & Sorcery: Northwind Tales – Challenge Set
boardgame.description: The Northwind Tales Challenge Set is a collection of all the "rank and file" enemies (green and blue) included in Northwind Tales in a variant rank, allowing players to modify the game difficulty and the overall game experience by combining the original enemies with these new enemies.

boardgame.name: Spearmint Island
boardgame.description:
Spearmint Island is being invaded, and it’s up to the lesser spirits and natives of the island to fend off the attacks and save themselves from being wiped from existence! As the player, you take on the role of a spirit that inhabits the island and use a mix of powers at the right time to stop the invaders from spreading out and ravaging the land. The invaders are strong, but your spirit will grow in power as the game progresses. Will you be able to send the invaders fleeing from your homeland, or will the island succumb to their ever-increasing population and blighting of the land?

—description from the designer

boardgame.description:

From the back of the book:
Entrate nell’oscuro mondo delle forze occulte, della stregoneria e di tutto ciò che vi è di misterioso e sovrannaturale nel mondo divorato dai Morti

English translation:

boardgame.name: Carcass Crawler (Issue #2 - May 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue 2 of Carcass Crawler — the official Old-School Essentials zine! Each issue is packed with new material for your games, including new character classes and races, new spells and magic items, new monsters, optional and expanded rules, referee advice, news, previews of in-development products, short adventures, and more!

In This Issue
New classes and races: Two new elf variants. The phase elf and the wood elf.
Item-based encumbrance system: A simple system for tracking characters' loads and movement rates, based on the number of items carried. (No more need to add up coins and weights.)
Town services: Guidelines and prices for inns, jewellers, money changers, and traders, including a simple optional rule for haggling.
Hiring retainers: Tables and extra guidelines for locating and hiring retainers.
Quick equipment: A set of tables for expediting character creation by randomly selecting starting gear.
Energy weapons: Complete rules for introducing high-tech energy blades and guns into your game, either as alien relics found in long lost treasure hoards or to accompany the sci-fi inspired classes in Carcass Crawler issue 1 (the hephaestan and kineticist).
Snake cult monsters: 8 brand new monsters: creepy undead, guardian constructs, and devious serpents.
The tomb of Aum-Pharath: A mini-adventure in the trap-filled ruins of a snake cult temple.
Adjudicating traps: Advice and optional guidelines for making traps a fun and engaging part of the game.

boardgame.name: Arm's Length
boardgame.description:
Cards
52, ranking AKQJ1098765432 in each suit.

Deal
Deal each player 13 cards, one at a time and face down.

Object
In each round one member of each partnership aims to win as many tricks as possible and the other as few as possible. The difference between the numbers of tricks they win is their 'arm's length'.

Play
After examining their cards two partners agree which of them will take the high road and which the low. The player at dealer's left leads to the first trick. There is no trump suit until someone can't follow suit to the card led. Whatever they then discard to that trick establishes trumps for the rest of the round.

Any card may be led to a trick, but the rules of following are 'forcing'. This means that you must seek to win the trick if you can (even if, as the low player, you don’t want to).

The trick is taken by the highest card of the suit led or by the highest trump if any are played, and the winner of each trick leads to the next.

Score
At end of play each partnership scores 10 times their arm's length plus the number taken by the high player.

boardgame.name: Basileus II
boardgame.description:
Basileus II is the sixth module of the game system "À la Charge !". It uses the special characteristics of Basileus, such as Unseizable, and the particularly formidable units, the Byzantine cataphracts.

With a standard hex & counter "I go - You go" system, players play certain number of turns, in each of which there are movement & combat phases for both players, until the victory conditions are met (usually reaching a morale threshold for eliminated units). The game includes typical wargame concepts like Zone of Control, command, ranged fire or close combat (melee), checking morale and retreating.

There are five proposed battles:

Andrassos 960
Orontes 994
Azaz 1030
Manzikert 1071
Zombos Bridge 1074

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark Heroes 3
Le Trône de Fer: Jeu de Figurines – Héros Stark 3
boardgame.description: House Stark is the last major House in Westeros’ northern reaches. The strong people of Winterfell are always prepared, the core of which is a tight-knit family, surrounded by many faithful bannermen. The House has marched to war, led by Robb, the King in the North, as he seeks revenge on those for what has happened to his father, Ned, Hand of the King, in King’s Landing. He is joined by many, such as Maege and Lyanna Mormont, Brynden “Blackfish” Tully, and Rickard Karstark, all pledging themselves to the Stark’s cause. These hardy individuals will show that House Stark’s toughness against the cold shall spread to all corners of Westeros.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark vs Lannister Starter Set

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannisport City Watch
Le Trône de Fer: Jeu de Figurines – Guet de Port-Lannis
boardgame.description:
The Lannisport Enforcers Unit Box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Lannister a new, stalwart unit for their formations. Armed with deadly spears and suited in sturdy armor, they may not be the best choice for a vanguard but having them hold a flank is well within their means as they adapt to both offensive and defensive needs. Plus, their resolve keeps them in a fight, especially when outnumbering the enemy.

Contents:
12 Miniatures
‣ 1 Bannerman
‣11 Lannisport City Watch
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannister Heroes 3
Le Trône de Fer: Jeu de Figurines – Héros Lannister 3
boardgame.description: With Joffrey Baratheon’s ascension to the Iron Throne, House Lannister controls King’s Landing from behind the throne. With ambition as deep as their coffers, House Lannister seeks to legitimize their claim on the throne. Queen Cersei & Tommen exert their influence in the halls of power while out in the field, her brother Jaime, despite being taken hostage, still works towards the Lannister’s favor. Sir Kevan Lannister works to see his niece’s ambitions met. Meanwhile, the House’s allies such as The Mountain that Rides, Ser Addam Marbrand, Qyburn, and Ser Robert Strong work to maintain House Lannister’s grip on the Iron Throne. It will not be broken easily.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark vs Lannister Starter Set

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Drowned Men
Le Trône de Fer: Jeu de Figurines – Les Noyés
boardgame.description: Armored with only their faith, and armed only with deadwood cudgels and other detritus from a storm-wracked shore; the Drowned Men make surprisingly effective support for followers of the Kraken banner. Their presence in battle signifies the Drowned God’s blessing, bolstering men to fight past their wounds and strike all the harder against their foes. While few in number, the drowned Men’s faith is such that they can survive even killing blows. That said, strong as their faith may be, a wise commander should not be putting these fanatics in the vanguard. Working with flankers or in direct support of the line ensures the Drowned God’s blessings are shared equally among his people.

Le Trône de Fer: Jeu de Figurines – Oursières de la Grêve Glacée
boardgame.description:
The Frozen Shore Bear Riders unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Free Folk commanders one of the hardiest cavalry units ever fielded in battle. While being kicked by a destrier might be a worry, it doesn’t hold a candle to being mauled by a bear while its rider stabs at you with their spear. Enemies are sure to be in disarray when this monstrous cavalry unit makes it into battle.

boardgame.name: The Case of The Cautious Condor
boardgame.description:
Take off on a fabulous flight into an air of mystery with Aimtech Corp.'s production of "The Case of The Cautious Condor."

Megalomaniac millionaire Bronson Barnard has invited a select group from international society to celebrate the maiden flight of his extravagant flying boat, the Condor. But more than champagne and caviar will be served up at this transatlantic soiree because Barnard knows that someone on this exclusive guest list is a murderer!

With your help, private eye Ned Peters must discover who the killer is. So come along on a flight into history and solve the mystery of "The Case of The Cautious Condor.

-- from the back of the jewel case of the English DOS CD-ROM edition.

One of the first games made specifically for CD-ROM and first released in Japan. The player has to solve the mystery by moving around rooms looking for clues, and by overhearing conversations between the other guests. The game has no text but is audio only; the player uses a mouse only.

--paraphrased from Wikipedia

boardgame.name: Space Fruit Tree
boardgame.description:
1 - 2 player space-themed tile game in which you grow a space fruit tree to earn points

Grow the largest tree, take some fruit and win!

In this 1 or 2 player space themed tile game you will grow a space fruit tree to earn points.

During the 1 player game you'll Grow 2 Space Fruit Trees on your own while keeping each tree balanced so you can score as many points as possible.

During the 2 player game you'll be able to steal branches and fruit from your opponent's tree to earn even more points. The first player to earn 15 points wins!

boardgame.name: Commandeer
boardgame.description: A strategic, flicking game where you combo into the other players ships to commandeer them as your own. To win you must kill all of your oppononent's ships or kill his king. Just be sure not to commit treason or you lose the game!

boardgame.name: The Finest Fish
boardgame.description:
Fishkeeping is a competitive hobby! Every fish owner wants to win the coveted Best in Show award at the national goldfish competition, but to have the most attractive pet, you need to carefully plan its colors and design.

In The Finest Fish, you complete design objectives and arrange colorful scales on your goldfish in order to create the finest fish in the show.

boardgame.name: Nova Burn: Tabletop Shmup Action
boardgame.description:
Tabletop. Shmup. Action.

Choose your ship, load the wave, and blast 'em all in this tactical, grid-based RPG! Each wave is made of a set of enemy ships who fire a bullet pattern at you. It is then your turn to dodge and return fire!

Nova Burn uses simple, easy to learn d6 rules to emulate classic shoot 'em up video games through tactical combat. It is for one player and you can play by writing in the book!

—description from the publisher

—description behind the box

boardgame.name: Innsmouth: The Stolen Child
boardgame.description:
Innsmouth is a dark and shadowed town full of secrets and danger.

You are a private investigator, paid to find a child kidnapped by the townsfolk. But beware, the residents aren't quite what you expect.

You must use all your skills and experience to help you solve the mystery of the stolen child and escape with your sanity and your life intact.

boardgame.name: Boocoo Fire Mission
boardgame.description:
Boocoo Fire Mission is the result of 3 years of research and playtesting, drawing from first-hand accounts of the war to create a wargame seasoned with plenty of historical flavor. A simple and effective hidden movement system allows players to really sweat as they try to work out if it's safe to cross that open field in front of them. Plans don't usually survive contact with the enemy, and a number of mishap tables help to create a narrative experience that goes beyond your average "move and shoot" wargame.

Boocoo Fire Mission is aimed at 6mm or 15mm miniatures, and can be played on a 4' x 4' or 6' x 4' table.

This game is company scaled, and the smallest maneuver unit is the squad, with players generally controlling 2 - 4 platoons, each with a number of squads and an HQ. Players will direct their forces on the ground, as well as coordinating support such as air strikes, artillery, and taking advantage of special assets such as VC spider holes or booby traps, or the NVA's stubborn resistance and uncanny ability to recover casualties, preventing US a body count...

Rules are provided for infantry, from the lowest quality ARVN troops, to the most elite ANZAC SAS and US Recon squads, and their various weapon attachments such as RPGs, LMGs, Recoilless rifles, and mortars, as well as helicopters such as the UH-1, AH-1 Cobra, OH-6 Loach and CH-47 Chinook. Vehicles such as the M113, M48 Patton, M551 Sheridan, various marine "amtracs", the M42 Duster, and M50 Ontos are also covered.

Boocoo Fire Mission is has a descending level of detail, with infantry as the most detailed unit in the game, followed by helicopters, and finally vehicles. Infantry can hide, dig in, crawl to avoid opportunity fire, and conduct suppression. Helicopters have detailed damage tables to provide for many interesting results from fire, and can drop off and pick up infantry on the table. Vehicles can disembark their crew, leaving sentries behind to man a single weapon, and can also transport infantry.

Army lists are provided for ANZACs, ARVN, US army, Armored Cavalry, Mechanized companies, and US marines. VC and NVA are of course included, and some factions are split into different time periods depending on if their equipment evolved over the course of the war. Boocoo Fire Mission covers the entire Vietnam War, from early ARVN vs VC skirmishes in the early 1960s, through to 1975. Specific city fight lists are also included for both the Allied and Communist forces, to allow players to play battles such as those in Hue or Saigon.

The game provides printable markers, and a printer-friendly version of the rules is also provided. Note that the markers are only in the full-color version of the rules.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Necromunda: Underhive – Cawdor Gang Cards
boardgame.description:
This box contains 26 100mm x 75mm cards for use in games of Necromunda:

18x Cawdor gang-specific Tactics cards
8x Blank Fighter cards

You will need a copy of the Necromunda: Rulebook and Necromunda: House of Faith to use the contents of this set.

boardgame.name: Anastyr: Boss Battle Terrain Elements Expansion
boardgame.description: This cosmetic add-on replaces the terrain element standees used in boss battles.

boardgame.name: Anastyr: Region Terrain Elements Expansion
boardgame.description: This cosmetic expansion is a great replacement for the region-specific terrain element standees.

boardgame.name: Anastyr: Backdrop Expansion
boardgame.description:
Immerse yourself in the fantastic world of Anastyr with these backdrops that will transform your game board into a real diorama. From the high plains of the Jade Sea to the volcanoes of the Fortress of Anastyr, every region you pass through during your epic journey will benefit from this cosmetic enhancement, drastically increasing immersion for all players.

4 double sided backdrops (15x80cm)
3 reinforced plastic clips

boardgame.name: Block and Key: Adventureres Pack
boardgame.description:
Four cards with special adventurers:
- Keysmith allows you to place any 1 key at the bottom of either altar and then draw top card
- Sculptor allows you to discard at the end of your turn any number of blocks and to draw new ones
- Architect allows you, once per turn, after placing one block, to discard 1 block to place another
- Curators allows you, after placing a block, to draw one from any excavation sites closest to you

boardgame.name: Atlas Lost: Rise of the New Sovereigns
boardgame.description:
This game is set in Atlas Lost, a world ruined by AI warfare. Players try to unearth lost technology and take control of a new world. Where will you go, what will you focus on, and what kind of world will you aim for?

Atlas Lost: Rise of the New Sovereigns is a tech-tree, resource management, and civilization game that can be played by 2-4 players. In the game set-up, you play a combination of three of the five available techs. Each of these techs employs different board game mechanisms. You must use cards, collect resources, and employ unearthed tech to build up your own troops and gather fame faster than the players around you. Whoever first scores 30 points wins.

boardgame.name: Farm Fuss
boardgame.description:
The game takes place on a farm, where all the animals fight for their position in line to be the farmer's favourite. Players take turns playing the animal cards, which activate the animal's abilities and changes their position in line. The animal that is the closest to the farmer at the end of the game is the winner.
The goal of the game is to play the cards of the winning animal in order to gain as many victory points as possible.
